Abendego's Squall (1-2).description: A massive orca known as Abendego's Squall leaps from the water. Its mouth opens to snap against any part of the ship that it can reach.
Abendego's Squall (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[medicine|dc:20] (trained) to remove the harpoon, @Check[nature|dc:17] (trained) to calm the orca, or @Check[intimidation|dc:20] (trained) to scare the orca away; two total successes are required to subdue the orca
Abendego's Squall (1-2).hazardReset: The orca returns to hunt down the Snapdragon after 8 hours.
Abendego's Squall (1-2).hazardRoutine:
d Abendego's Squall Leaps over the Snapdragon with each action. When it lands, it deals @Damage[1] damage to the Snapdragon. All creatures on the deck take @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} until the end of its next turn.

Speed 30 feet
Abendego's Squall (1-2).name: Abendego's Squall (1-2)

d Abendego's Squall thrashes against the hull of the Snapdragon. With each action, it makes a flipper Strike against a PC adjacent to the railing. Whenever it makes a flipper Strike, it also deals its Strike damage to the ship whether or not the Strike was successful.

Speed 30 feet
Abendego's Squall (3-4).name: Abendego's Squall (3-4)

Speed 30 feet

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the end of its next turn.

YAQs97U3Fmu7R6dB.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The acid ooze spurts a blast of acid at a target (range 10 feet) dealing @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save.
YAQs97U3Fmu7R6dB.name: Acid Spurt

Adolescent Kirin.description:
Symbols of grace and purity, unicorns resemble proud and noble horses. They typically have pure white coats, but they are best known for the single, delicate horn that extends from the center of their forehead. While unicorns often serve as protectors of unspoiled wilderness and sacred places, they are themselves highly sought after for their horns, which are said to possess potent magical properties. To many, the mere idea of hunting such a magnificent creature in the hopes of severing its horn is utterly reprehensible. Indeed, a dehorned unicorn is a sorry sight, and few such unicorns survive much longer in the wild.

Unicorns are found almost exclusively in remote, unsullied areas of wilderness. Sometimes associated with good-aligned deities, other times associated with nature and the fey, unicorns are always known for their righteousness and nobility. They are wary, at best, of most humanoid creatures, due in large part to poachers' tendency to hunt them for their horns, but unicorns are often rumored to have a weakness for those who are pure of both heart and spirit. Despite some tales, unicorns are equally likely to recognize purity in people of all genders.

65E6IqqYN0IW2HsH.description: The kirin Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike. If the kirin moved at least 20 feet, it deals an additional @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage on a hit.
65E6IqqYN0IW2HsH.name: Powerful Charge

QL3594a7048GPCem.description: The kirin has a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows them to communicate with animals. They can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.
QL3594a7048GPCem.name: Animal Empathy

vNaUr8lkk7o1zXWJ.description: A kirin's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.
vNaUr8lkk7o1zXWJ.name: Ghost Touch

Adolescent Kirin.name: Adolescent Kirin

E8xhvhfUbIfDOmZq.description:
Requirements The amalgam ooze is targeted by an attack

Effect The multicolored surface of the amalgam ooze shifts rapidly. The attacking creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:18] save.
E8xhvhfUbIfDOmZq.name: Dazzling Surface

TIGzFU4lxbPN1wLr.description: An amalgam ooze can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
TIGzFU4lxbPN1wLr.name: Motion Sense

YgkVvxflxxnTYtDN.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The amalgam ooze spews liquid from its body at a creature, roll [[/gmr 1d6]] to determine the effect using the table below. Each is resisted with a successful @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save:

1: @Damage[(1d6+2)[acid]] damage

2–3: @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage

4–5: @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage

6: restore @Damage[1d6[healing]] hit points
YgkVvxflxxnTYtDN.name: Body Spout

0iKagCxTDFf1p9SV.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)
0iKagCxTDFf1p9SV.name: Bog Rot

OBpiSvaf3hSmsvXL.description: Amriya tightens hir group on Rotcarver and attempts a powerful Strike against hir enemy. On a success, ze deals an additional 1d10 piercing damage.
OBpiSvaf3hSmsvXL.name: Deskari's Rage

cgZ2ARrsevGLRMN7.description: Amriya's mouth opens, spewing forth a vapor that triggers rot and decay. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] must attempt a basic @Check[fortitude|dc:25|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:sickened] saving throw or take @Damage[3d12[void]|options:area-damage] damage. On a critical failure, creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for 1 minute.
cgZ2ARrsevGLRMN7.name: Rot and Ruin

XT0y11wxiGBpVoRU.description: The Chelaxian adjutant threatens their foes. All foes within 30 feet of the adjutant are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. They cannot reduce their frightened value so long as the adjutant maintains this ability. The adjutant must spend an action each round to maintain it.
XT0y11wxiGBpVoRU.name: I'll Make You Regret This!

Angry Mordant Spire Plunderer.description:
A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.description: The plunderer makes a melee Strike with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the plunderer can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the first Strike.
0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.name: Pike and Strike

u6QEft9DxfittKI2.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The plunderer orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the plunderer's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command}
u6QEft9DxfittKI2.name: Plunderer's Command

Angry Mordant Spire Plunderer.name: Angry Mordant Spire Plunderer

Angry Victims.description: The souls of the ghouls' recent meals cry out from their pile of bones in the nearby tunnel, lamenting their fate.
Angry Victims.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:12] (trained) sets the spirits at ease, or @Check[deception|dc:15], @Check[diplomacy|dc:15], or @Check[intimidation|dc:15] to convince the spirits to not interfere right now. A single success disables the haunt. PCs may accrue additional successes beyond the first—each one convinces the haunt to use telekinetic interference once against ghouls in the haunt's range instead of the living creatures.
Angry Victims.hazardRoutine: (two actions) The haunt uses one action to activate its gurgling gasp and then uses telekinetic interference for all of its other actions until it can use gurgling gasp again.
Angry Victims.name: Angry Victims

Animated Flame.description:
Although arguably quite friendly, fire scamps are considered far more dangerous than their kin. They delight in fire and playing pranks on everyone they befriend. Even given time to understand others' dislike of fire, most fire scamps enjoy the feel of flames enough to constantly test their limits.

Compared to the nations of other scamps, the nations on the Plane of Fire are by far the strongest. This backing inspires fire scamps to challenge authority more quickly than the others.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

JPfXLDy2dYseqUop.description: The animated flame ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
JPfXLDy2dYseqUop.name: Smoke Vision

UnZj5Xyb8m8zt4Wk.description: If the animated flame leaves the village, willingly or otherwise, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 2 rounds.
UnZj5Xyb8m8zt4Wk.name: Panic of Failure Foreseen

gMRZ46sjaLERrmao.description:
The animated flame breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

The animated flame can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
gMRZ46sjaLERrmao.name: Flame Breath

yAvraJf1ksBAcCOl.description: If the animated flame starts its turn outside the village after it arrives, it dissipates.
yAvraJf1ksBAcCOl.name: Price of Failure

Animated Flame.name: Animated Flame

5oNvHeYl8fSWHjol.description: Each creature within the baby scamp swarm's space takes @Damage[3d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).
5oNvHeYl8fSWHjol.name: Wing Buffet

6HXCsiEmnGjPRFYE.description: The baby scamp swarm can sense creatures with a connection to the elements. It is drawn to creatures that have cast an elemental spell or used an elemental ability within the last round.
6HXCsiEmnGjPRFYE.name: Elemental Draw

LMKjcjrOLzAwmZ48.description: A creature within the swarm's space that casts an elemental spell or uses an elemental ability does not need to make a flat check. Additionally, the baby scamps empower their spell causing the save DC to be 1 higher.
LMKjcjrOLzAwmZ48.name: Elemental Conduit

m9VusE56Xgs3pe4L.description:
The Young scamps all try to help the creatures in their space at the same time. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The creature is affected as if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} had been cast on them.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} until the end of their next turn.
m9VusE56Xgs3pe4L.name: We're Helping!

Apple Turnover.description: A fruit merchant's cart has been poorly secured. The slightest careless bump on the way past is enough to knock it over and topple the fruit it carries all over the street.
Apple Turnover.hazardDisable: If all the PCs succeed on a Perception check against the Stealth DC to spot the hazard, they're able to pass by that cart without triggering it. There's not enough time for PCs who succeed on this check to warn PCs who fail.
Apple Turnover.name: Apple Turnover

Arrogant Foroxicks.description:
Wargs hunt in packs like wolves, but their penchant for taunting victims makes them easy to distinguish from their cousins. Orcs and hobgoblins frequently recruit wargs. Most wargs are amenable to this arrangement, but if food should run out, wargs are more than willing to integrate goblinoid flesh into their diet.

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, and violent humanoids.

5PVmoxohmPUNRyeZ.description: Foroxicks breathes a cloud of frost in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] dealing @Damage[(5d8 - 4)[cold]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save). He can't use Winter Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Winter Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
5PVmoxohmPUNRyeZ.name: Winter Breath

BQkt9pmzJnmXvZLL.description:
Foroxicks becomes enraged if his silks, golden mirrors, or throne are damaged. He takes a –2 circumstance penalty to his jaws attack, but each hit deals 3 additional points of piercing damage for three rounds as he attacks with uncontrolled fury.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.ALYd08DB00ZeoHAp]{Effect: Pompous Rage}
BQkt9pmzJnmXvZLL.name: Pompous Rage

VfGIlE5o88e6ZuW6.description: Foroxicks's Strikes deals an extra 1d6 damage to any creature within reach of at least two of his allies.
VfGIlE5o88e6ZuW6.name: Pack Attack

Vg2UnnmNwX8ZkN0y.description: Foroxicks commands an ally to aid him. One ally uses a reaction to move up to their Speed into an open space to flank with Foroxicks.
Vg2UnnmNwX8ZkN0y.name: Do Your Job!

z4Mouf0sgt0pO2Vz.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the Foroxicks's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies.

Effect Foroxicks makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.
z4Mouf0sgt0pO2Vz.name: Avenging Bite

Arrogant Foroxicks.name: Arrogant Foroxicks

Ascending Xalreonshin.description:
Imugi (ee-moo-ghee) are dragon-like serpents with great mystic potential, including that of ascension into another form. While some imperial dragons are born to their birthright, many that currently roam Tian Xia are ascended imugi—though they would strike down anyone who claimed such.

To become an imperial dragon, imugi must care for a koi egg for a thousand years. The power from the nurtured egg hatching is enough to power a draconic ascension ritual, and whatever power lingers transforms the koi into an imugi to continue the cycle. The kind of imperial dragon that the imugi becomes depends on where it chooses to nurture the koi egg. Imugi strongly prefer long-finned koi, and Tian koi farmers have learned to keep a separate pool of these butterfly koi away from the others they tend, as imugi tend to displace quite a bit of water—and koi—when swooping down to snatch an egg they want.

Though imugi have some power over rain and storms, most aren't powerful enough to exact a true sense of weather control. Many are known for their benevolence, and some villages even rely on imugi's forays out of streams or lakes, bringing rains during the growing season. Imugi have as wide a range of temperaments as the dragons they become, and some are notorious for how their impatience twists into a foul temper or an arrogance that flicks people aside as if they were bugs. While some might consider mean-spirited imugi corrupted and claim they can be purified somehow, imugi simply hold themselves higher than the average creature and see no reason to conceal their true nature from someone they see as beneath them.

c55iM848V2sPZwgH.description:
Trigger A creature damages the imugi's chosen koi egg or ends its turn within 40 feet of the egg

Effect The imugi Strides or Swims toward the triggering creature. If they end their movement within reach of the creature, they can attempt a melee Strike against it.
c55iM848V2sPZwgH.name: Parental Wrath

ltcY6FVGf6RjYoXc.description: Waters rush forth in a @Template[type:line|distance:60], dealing @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save and aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the imugi are pushed 10 feet away.
ltcY6FVGf6RjYoXc.name: Floodwaters

mmx6yUYJ42TG8Xpr.description: The imugi twists any nearby precipitation into a swirling veil of sleet and wind. They gain concealment when in any form of mist or rain.
mmx6yUYJ42TG8Xpr.name: Storm Veil

yITYMWlpAGzufql4.description: By coiling around a butterfly koi egg for 1 minute, the imugi designates it as their chosen heir, which grants the imugi the effects of a constant status spell on that egg. If the egg is destroyed or otherwise made nonviable, the imugi can choose a new koi egg with this ability after 1 week.
yITYMWlpAGzufql4.name: Nesting

Ascending Xalreonshin.name: Ascending Xalreonshin

G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.description: The automatic greeter has Hardness. Once the automatic greeter is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 18.
G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)

9PyQKrYhwwi2TOSM.description:
Frequency once per round;

Effect Averill orders an ally to attack or to get in position. The ally can immediately Strike or move up to half its swim Speed. If it moves, the movement does not trigger reactions.
9PyQKrYhwwi2TOSM.name: Averill's Orders

Q5Qd599tQTMtgOYk.description: Averill swims up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
Q5Qd599tQTMtgOYk.name: Swift Stroke

Effect Averill whispers into the creature's ears, compelling them to join him. The creature is unable to attack Averill Quint for the duration, unless Averill uses a hostile action against them, and any undead Pathfinder can treat the creature as an ally for purposes of flanking. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The curse lasts 1 round.

Critical Failure The curse lasts 2 rounds.
VevwO6BlBLu9jVZA.name: Grave Tidings

qWNxjCGkNzFWuJsx.description: Averill devours his raw fish and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points.
qWNxjCGkNzFWuJsx.name: Consume Flesh

Critical Success The creature is affected as if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance} had been cast on them.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} until the end of their next turn.
m9VusE56Xgs3pe4L.name: We're Helping!

Barbed Stegosaurus.description:
The stegosaurus is easily recognized by its twin rows of diamond-shaped dorsal plates that run down its spine and thick tail adorned with four large spikes. This configuration protects the herbivore, the plates deflecting attacks while it gores predators with its tail.

The stegosaurus is generally even-tempered and gentle, despite its size. This combination makes it even more popular as a trained pet or guard, but even then one should take care to not annoy the dinosaur—an angry stegosaurus can lash out with little warning.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

sSd80IXHhedyt6q5.description:
Trigger The stegosaurus is targeted with a melee attack.

Effect The stegosaurus leans its dorsal plates into the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the stegosaurus Steps after the attack.
sSd80IXHhedyt6q5.name: Dorsal Deflection

Barbed Stegosaurus.name: Barbed Stegosaurus

Big Carnival Bear.description:
This large and powerful omnivore inhabits forested hills. While it typically sustains itself on nuts, berries, fish, and small mammals, it's fiercely territorial and will chase off or kill any creature it views as competition. Grizzly bears are especially temperamental when their young are nearby. In combat, a grizzly bear often attempts to grab and maul its foe with surprising ferocity. It continues its assault until its foe seems like it is no longer a threat, though if the bear is hungry, it will not hesitate to feed.

Bears are ferocious predators typically found in cold or temperate woodlands and hills. Many species of bear exist in addition to the two presented below, such as the smaller black bear or the arctic-dwelling polar bear.

Emupr9krjKNn5xjb.description: The big carnival bear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. After damaging a creature it has grabbed, it automatically releases it from its grip, but also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} unless the target succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save.
Emupr9krjKNn5xjb.name: Not So Gentle Mauler

UImzHQZgpKz2aCta.description:
The big carnival bear isn't well trained yet, though it might occasionally respond to commands. Whatever its current attitude, use the following degrees of success instead of the usual check results for attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} against the big carnival bear.

Critical Success The bear does as commanded on its next turn.

Success The bear acts normally (as determined by the GM) on its next turn.

Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn.

Critical Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn, and becomes immune to Command an Animal for 1 minute.
UImzHQZgpKz2aCta.name: Somewhat Less Trained

lN9hEunTXVI3YGXA.description: The big carnival bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, the bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.
lN9hEunTXVI3YGXA.name: Rush

Big Carnival Bear.name: Big Carnival Bear

Big Katsu.description:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of their own game can often enrage the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum provides an opportunity for the captives to escape.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

DvjFG8xZGQmhN7AK.description: The ogre glutton Strides twice and makes a jaws Strike. If they damage a living creature with this Strike, the temporary Hit Points they receive from Glutton's Feast is increased to 2d4.
DvjFG8xZGQmhN7AK.name: Glutton's Rush

Fs4kRRF969DGHzVA.description: Big Katsu takes on the size and form of an Oni (already reflected in the stat block).
Fs4kRRF969DGHzVA.name: Oni Form

SzfxfFohnnwRyEeK.description:
If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws Strike, they gain 1d4 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ww0Wu8majCej2tVF]{Effect: Glutton's Feast}
SzfxfFohnnwRyEeK.name: Glutton's Feast

Big Katsu.name: Big Katsu

6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.description:
The elegecide lashes out with its trailing dorsal fins, looping them around a target within 15 feet. It sends a burst of telepathic information about all the possible ways the target can be injured in the next minute. The target takes @Damage[(5d4)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the elegecide.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the elegecide.
6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.name: Dorsal Lash

9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.description: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.
9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.name: Telepathy (100 feet)

prtTIT0LyapARhoz.description: The elegecide is fueled by the certainty of doom, which leaves it weakened by any hope. The first time each round that a creature critically fails at an attack or skill check against the elegecide, it experiences a burst of hope that leaves it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
prtTIT0LyapARhoz.name: Hope Vulnerability

y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.description:
30 feet

The elegecide constantly emits telepathic warnings about future dangers and harm. When a non-demon creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).
y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.name: Doom Aura

Blood-Awakened Tree.description:
Arboreal regents and other wielders of powerful primal magic grant temporary sentience to trees in order to protect the forest. Invested with a workable set of instincts and the ability to mobilize and attack, these awakened trees follow the commands of their master and fight to protect their home. The statistics below work just as well for foliage that has become animate via other methods, such as a mystical influence from another dimension, a capricious fey spirit, or the like.

Arboreals are guardians of the forest and representatives of the trees. As long-lived as the woods they watch over, arboreals consider themselves parents and shepherds of trees rather than their gardeners. Consequently, while arboreals tend to be slow and methodical, they are terrifyingly swift when forced to fight in defense of the woods. Though they rarely seek out the companionship of short-lived folk—even elves are fugacious in the eyes of arboreals—and have an inherent distrust of change, arboreals have been known to tolerate those who seek to learn from their long-winded, rambling monologues, especially if such pupils also express a desire to protect the timberlands. Against those who threaten their realm, such as loggers eager to harvest lumber or settlers aiming to establish croplands or a town, arboreals' wrath is unwavering and devastating. Perhaps ironically, arboreals are gifted at tearing down what others build—a trait that serves vengeful members of their kind well.

nyRGQVu4E8bvJOAa.description:
Requirements The blood-awakened tree's last action was a successful root Strike against a target currently taking persistent bleed damage.

Effect The tree drives its roots into the target's open wounds and drinks their blood. The roots Strike deals piercing damage with an additional 2d6 piercing, and the tree recovers hit points equal to half the additional damage dealt.
nyRGQVu4E8bvJOAa.name: Drink Blood

Blood-Awakened Tree.name: Blood-Awakened Tree

Blood-Soaked Flytrap.description:
Snapping flytraps typically have two sets of tooth-edged leaves, each measuring 3 feet wide, at the end of 10-foot-long stalks.

Flytraps eagerly feed on humanoids, monstrous insects, and larger prey.

QTipkgJAwLBZFcwu.description: The flytrap attacks a single target with both its two leaves, the fury of the red godsrain driving it to rip its prey to shreds. The flytrap makes one leaf Strike. On a success, it deals the damage from two leaf strikes plus 1d8 persistent bleed damage. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf Strike and no persistent damage. It deals no damage on a critical failure. No matter the result, it cannot use Improved Grab on any of these Strikes. This counts as 2 attacks for purposes of the flytrap's multiple attack penalty.
QTipkgJAwLBZFcwu.name: Bloody Focused Assault

gXUEOhZBMg1NCOMw.description:
Trigger A creature hits or touches the flytrap.

Effect The flytrap makes a leaf Strike against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in that leaf.
gXUEOhZBMg1NCOMw.name: Quick Capture

oB9Lh7ZFScaG3Z04.description: The flytrap makes two leaf Strikes at a -2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.
oB9Lh7ZFScaG3Z04.name: Hungry Flurry

Blood-Soaked Flytrap.name: Blood-Soaked Flytrap

OCYtPsv3fWOckHQM.description: When Searching or Seeking for creatures who have taken piercing or slashing damage in the last 24 hours, the wild dog's sense of smell is precise.

A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.name: Cybernetics

Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.
Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.name: Guzzle

YWzEkwp5ZbNl5zmJ.description: The brain guzzler fires with the ulna bow, which rips the ulna out of its own forearm and fires it at one target within 120 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or take @Damage[(2d8+5)[piercing]] damage. The ulna explodes on impact, dealing @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage to adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). Once the ulna bow has been used once it can't be used again.
YWzEkwp5ZbNl5zmJ.name: Ulna Bow

Burning Building.hazardDisable: @Check[survival|dc:19] to beat the flames with a stage curtain or similar cloth, @Check[acrobatics|dc:14] to splash liquids onto the fire, or 5 points of cold damage.
Burning Building.name: Burning Building

3mxJAxXK3WS0aU5X.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his voice.

Effect Najid screams at one creature within 20 feet, freezing their muscles with his rage. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is Stunned 2.

Failure the target is Stunned for one round.

Critical Failure the target is Stunned for one round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round thereafter.

Regardless of outcome, Najid's focus leaves his voice.
3mxJAxXK3WS0aU5X.name: Fennic Scream

4yGrEXXmjvqCtPbL.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his blades.

Effect Najid's blades ignite for just a moment. He can make two Strikes with his burning blades, each against the same target and Najid's current multiple attack penalty. If both attacks hit, combine their damage for the purposes of weakness and resistance. Both strikes deal fire damage regardless of the usual damage type. This counts as two attacks when calculating Najid's multiple attack penalty. Najid's focus leaves his blades.
4yGrEXXmjvqCtPbL.name: Burning Strike

Rfe5RFkcdLDaqo3v.description: Najid focuses his divine spark into his short swords, his voice, or his smile, allowing himself to use the associated exemplar ability.
Rfe5RFkcdLDaqo3v.name: Sliver of Divinity

oshU7JjyLUWqtRhZ.description:
Requirements Najid's divine spark is focused in his smile.

Effect Najid focuses on a creature within 30 feet while smiling confidently. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Success the target is unaffected.

Failure the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for one round. The condition ends if Najid uses a hostile action against the target, but not if Najid uses a hostile action against the target's allies.

Critical Failure the target is fascinated for one minute. The condition ends if Najid uses a hostile action against the target, but not if Najid uses a hostile action against the target's allies.

Regardless of outcome, Najid's focus leaves his smile.
oshU7JjyLUWqtRhZ.name: Roguish Smile

Cackling Skull.description:
Some beheaded are raised with their mental faculties mostly intact. These clever undead often provoke their victims into foolishly giving chase or harming themselves.

Beheaded are disembodied floating heads transformed into undead. They are natural candidates for a necromancer's "project minion," due to the inexpensive cost of creation and endlessly customizable nature. In any lair occupied for long by practicing necromancers, it isn't uncommon to find a handful of floating heads roaming about, each exhibiting completely different characteristics and even degrees of expertise in their creation.

je6z12w9bwlsz6kk.description:
The skull chooses one creature within 60 feet and antagonizes it mercilessly. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save to resist the effect.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. On its next turn, if the taunting skull is within the target's reach, the target wildly attacks the taunting skull as many times as possible.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target also immediately performs a Strike against itself; this Strike doesn't take any actions.
je6z12w9bwlsz6kk.name: Incessant Goading

qxv9k072qjlqqrmv.description:
Trigger The cackling skull is attacked by a creature within their reach

Effect The cackling skull makes a jaws Strike against that creature.
qxv9k072qjlqqrmv.name: Bite Back

Cackling Skull.name: Cackling Skull

Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.description: A metal lattice forged from warshards feeds into a dark purplish crystal that pulses with energy. If the configuration of the lattice changes, so does the energy the device emits.
Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.hazardDisable: Three [[/act disable-device dc=27]] (see Disabling the Focus under Event 1 on page 18).
Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The Nahyndrian Focus uses Select Condition to determine which condition it is going to inflict. It then uses Inflict twice, usually on two different targets. If the focus is broken, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and can only Inflict once per turn.
Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus.name: Calibrated Nahyndrian Focus

Captain Fraez.description:
The captain is the ultimate authority on a vessel, responsible for the livelihood and well-being of everyone on the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

5iTqDt4fDSnYuJIg.description:
The captain makes two Strikes, one with their rapier and one with their main-gauche (in either order). If both Strikes hit, the ship captain can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the target.

Their multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.
5iTqDt4fDSnYuJIg.name: Dual Disarm

FMRFRcuXn2QHFX2v.description: When Captain Fraez rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, anytime they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.
FMRFRcuXn2QHFX2v.name: Bravery

OjePIuXOLgAEb4RG.description:
The captain orders their shipmates to fight without mercy. All allied creatures of equal or lower level within 20 feet of the ship captain gain a+1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the ship captain's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TjRZbd52qWPjTbNT]{Effect: No Quarter!}
OjePIuXOLgAEb4RG.name: No Quarter!

Captain Fraez.name: Captain Fraez

2byeGaISmswuUpxU.description: When Captain Nanaeil rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.
2byeGaISmswuUpxU.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden

4LPO8MfLTdkoM9NV.description: Nanaeil lashes out at his foe with both weapons. He makes two Strikes, one with each melee weapon, each using his current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If both attacks hit, combine their damage, then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. Precision damage is added only once. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty.
4LPO8MfLTdkoM9NV.name: Double Slice

NQMFcbNx3quS2mgG.description: The Pure Legion's scimitars have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.
NQMFcbNx3quS2mgG.name: Smite Divine

QOT0UbjPYnIIySH9.name: +2 on All Saves Against Divine Magic

jr5CFCk4BfGaQErO.description: Pitros Nanaeil is highly trained in the art of wielding two weapons at once, preferring to wield the +1 striking scimitar in his main hand and the bloodletting kukri in his off-hand.
jr5CFCk4BfGaQErO.name: Dual-Weapon Warrior

liIsPsXqsjby7neR.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically fails to Strike you.

A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against the triggering opponent.
liIsPsXqsjby7neR.name: Twin Riposte

r0C8GUjKqvNfnURR.description: 30 feet. As captain of the Pure Legion, Nanaeil bolsters the lower-level legionnaires under his command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and +2 status bonus to their will saves.
r0C8GUjKqvNfnURR.name: Aura of Command

Captain Pitros Nanaeil.name: Captain Pitros Nanaeil
Captain Pitros Nanaeil.npcAllSaves: +2 on all saves against divine magic

Carnival Bear.description:
This large and powerful omnivore inhabits forested hills. While it typically sustains itself on nuts, berries, fish, and small mammals, it's fiercely territorial and will chase off or kill any creature it views as competition. Grizzly bears are especially temperamental when their young are nearby. In combat, a grizzly bear often attempts to grab and maul its foe with surprising ferocity. It continues its assault until its foe seems like it is no longer a threat, though if the bear is hungry, it will not hesitate to feed.

Bears are ferocious predators typically found in cold or temperate woodlands and hills. Many species of bear exist in addition to the two presented below, such as the smaller black bear or the arctic-dwelling polar bear.

Emupr9krjKNn5xjb.description: The carnival bear gains +1 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. After damaging a creature it has grabbed, it automatically releases the creature from its grip.
Emupr9krjKNn5xjb.name: Gentle Mauler

UImzHQZgpKz2aCta.description:
The carnival bear might respond to commands even while hostile or unfriendly. If it's hostile or unfriendly, use the following degrees of success instead of the usual check results for attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} against the bear.

Critical Success The bear does as commanded on its next turn.

Success The bear hesitates and does nothing on its next turn.

Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn.

Critical Failure The bear attacks the creature attempting to command it on its next turn, and becomes immune to Command an Animal for 1 minute.
UImzHQZgpKz2aCta.name: Somewhat Trained

Carnival Bear.name: Carnival Bear

SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.description:
Trigger An enemy in this creature's champion's aura damages them

Effect This creature gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, regardless of damage type. In addition, their Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra spirit damage until the end of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.h6nyMp4dtPXBfCJc]{Effect: Selfish Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2a6fuugiPpICe3Li]{Effect: Champion's Extra Damage}
SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.name: Selfish Shield

wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.description: When the champion of Deskari critically succeeds at a Strike against an enemy with their scythe, their enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and moved 5 feet in the direction of the champion's choice. This is forced movement.
wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.name: Powerful Faith

XT0y11wxiGBpVoRU.description:
Frequency 1/day.

The Chelaxian adjutant shouts at all present. The adjutant makes an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check and compares it to the Will DCs of all enemies within 30 feet. On a success, that foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. A critical success does not grant an additional effect.
XT0y11wxiGBpVoRU.name: Do You Know Who I Am?!

5htRdF1rfm6GJpZW.description: The Chelaxian assassin deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7Ogm29t4rEPoNaQE.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian assassin is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from the target of this ability

Effect The Chelaxian assassin makes a Strike with a dagger. If they hit and deal damage, the damaged creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit).
7Ogm29t4rEPoNaQE.name: Strike of Terror

EwnTH8rlknL4HtGv.name: +2 to Perception to Detect Snares and Hazards

JzPo3j8Ai0TyOMVO.description: The Chelaxian assassin is an expert at maintaining perfect stillness and blending into their surroundings. Each non-ally creature who has not been targeted by or subject to an attack or effect made by the Chelaxian assassin must, at the start of their turn, succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save (@Check[will|dc:28] in dungeon environments while the Chelaxian assassin is wearing their camouflage suit) or the Chelaxian assassin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them. This effect ends if the Chelaxian assassin moves without Sneaking or takes any hostile action against the non-ally creature. This does not prevent a creature from making Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, making the assassin Observed as normal on a success.
JzPo3j8Ai0TyOMVO.name: Unnoticeable Guile

g8O97glEhtcBiELZ.description:
This bandolier is covered in straps and pouches capable of holding up to 2 Bulk of one-handed thrown weapons. A thrower's bandolier has a +1 weapon potency rune etched into it, and it can be etched with runes as though it were a one-handed thrown weapon. When you invest the thrower's bandolier, you can attune it to all the weapons sheathed in it (this ends any previous attunements made with the bandolier). Whenever you draw a weapon from the bandolier, the bandolier's runes are replicated onto that weapon. Any runes already on the weapon are suppressed, and any runes previously replicated to a different weapon in this way are removed, returning it to normal.

Activate 2 envision, Interact

Effect All weapons attuned to the bandolier, not including any weapons you're currently wielding, return to the bandolier.
g8O97glEhtcBiELZ.name: +1 Striking Thrower's Bandolier

hrKTUcRzWZm5Qhmc.description: When the Chelaxian assassin successfully Feints, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Chelaxian assassin's weapon attacks until the end of the Chelaxian assassin's next turn. On a critical success, the target is off-guard against all weapon attacks for that time, not just the Chelaxian assassin's.
hrKTUcRzWZm5Qhmc.name: Devilish Feint

PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian cleric takes damage from a melee attack

Effect The Chelaxian cleric promises unholy retribution upon the attacker and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.
PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.name: Unholy Rebuke

nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The Chelaxian cleric finishes Casting a Spell using one of their divine spell slots

Effect Until the end of their turn, the Chelaxian cleric's Strikes gain the unholy trait and deal an additional 1d4 spirit damage; this damage increases to 2d4 against creatures with the holy trait.
nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.name: Divine Weapon

ESDBq0xFsFgtElmi.description: The Chelaxian devilcaster can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qvagIV8gqF0g3m3l]{Vordine} devil. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[fire]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the Chelaxian devilcaster is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure. Regardless of whether the spell continues or not, the vordine devil attacks whatever creature is closest to it indiscriminately. If the Chelaxian devilcaster dies, the devil disappears.
ESDBq0xFsFgtElmi.name: Devil Summoning

cgTJQzySanVtWglT.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian devilcaster takes fire damage

Effect The Chelaxian devilcaster gains resistance 8 to fire against the triggering attack. If this damage came from an unarmed attack, a non-reach melee weapon, or a spell with a range of touch, the creature who caused the damage takes @Damage[8[fire]] damage.
cgTJQzySanVtWglT.name: Brimstone Defense

vTRZSJ3M3RSOpMCo.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian mage's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The Chelaxian mage siphons devilish energy drawn from pacts with a vordine devil into their trident. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage, gains the unholy trait, and gains the effects of a returning rune.
vTRZSJ3M3RSOpMCo.name: Brimstone Blessing

yd5OLxJNpoC4Wofe.name: Infernal Magics of the Armies of Dis

8vjzKAzrN7P4jfBI.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

UvJdT9nuDSWWQ7kb.description: The Chelaxian fighter exhorts a faltering comrade with a stern word. The Chelaxian fighter attempts an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check against the Will DC of one ally within 30 feet. On a success, the target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is reduced by 2, and the Chelaxian fighter can attempt to counteract one mental effect that ally is suffering from with a [[/r 1d20+15 #Counteract]]{+15} counteract modifier. On a critical success, the Chelaxian fighter also reduces the frightened condition of each other ally in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the target by 1.
UvJdT9nuDSWWQ7kb.name: Chastising Enforcement

YmlswdyaBq4Tz5j4.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian fighter's last action was a Strike that hit an opponent

Effect The Chelaxian fighter twists their blade and pushes with their shield to create an opening in the required opponent's defenses. That opponent takes a –2 status penalty to their AC against the next Strike made against them before the start of the Chelaxian fighter's next turn. While this penalty lasts, the Chelaxian fighter gains an additional reaction they can only use to make a Reactive Strike against the penalized opponent.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IPfr5O7bTwJhRB5v]{Effect: Create Opening}
YmlswdyaBq4Tz5j4.name: Create Opening

PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian hierophant takes damage from a melee attack

Effect The Chelaxian hierophant promises unholy retribution upon the attacker and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.
PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.name: Unholy Rebuke

nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The Chelaxian hierophant finishes Casting a Spell using one of their divine spell slots

Effect Until the end of their turn, the Chelaxian hierophant's Strikes gain the unholy trait and deal an additional 1d4 spirit damage; this damage increases to 2d4 against creatures with the holy trait.
nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.name: Divine Weapon

ESDBq0xFsFgtElmi.description: The Chelaxian mage can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qvagIV8gqF0g3m3l]{Vordine} devil. To do so, they must sacrifice three 3rd-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[fire]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the Chelaxian mage is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure; regardless of whether the spell continues or not, the vordine devil attacks whatever creature is closest to it indiscriminately. If the Chelaxian mage dies, the devil disappears.
ESDBq0xFsFgtElmi.name: Devil Summoning

cgTJQzySanVtWglT.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian mage takes fire damage

Effect The Chelaxian mage gains resistance 6 to fire against the triggering attack. If this damage came from an unarmed attack, a non-reach melee weapon, or a spell with a range of touch, the creature who caused the damage takes @Damage[6[fire]] damage.
cgTJQzySanVtWglT.name: Brimstone Defense

vTRZSJ3M3RSOpMCo.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian mage's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The Chelaxian mage siphons devilish energy drawn from pacts with a vordine devil into their trident. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage, gains the unholy trait, and gains the effects of a returning rune.
vTRZSJ3M3RSOpMCo.name: Brimstone Blessing

yd5OLxJNpoC4Wofe.name: Infernal Magics of the Armies of Dis

5htRdF1rfm6GJpZW.description: The Chelaxian rogue deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7Ogm29t4rEPoNaQE.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian rogue is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from the target of this ability

Effect The Chelaxian rogue makes a Strike with a dagger. If they hit and deal damage, the damaged creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit).
7Ogm29t4rEPoNaQE.name: Strike of Terror

EwnTH8rlknL4HtGv.name: +2 to Perception to Detect Snares and Hazards

JzPo3j8Ai0TyOMVO.description: The Chelaxian rogue is an expert at maintaining perfect stillness and blending into their surroundings. Each non-ally creature who has not been targeted by or subject to an attack or effect made by the Chelaxian rogue must, at the start of their turn, succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save (@Check[will|dc:27] in dungeon environments while the Chelaxian rogue is wearing their camouflage suit) or the Chelaxian rogue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them. This effect ends if the Chelaxian rogue moves without Sneaking or takes any hostile action against the non-ally creature. This does not prevent a creature from making Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, making the rogue Observed as normal on a success.
JzPo3j8Ai0TyOMVO.name: Unnoticeable Guile

On a critical success, the target is off-guard against all weapon attacks for that time, not just the Chelaxian rogue's.
hrKTUcRzWZm5Qhmc.name: Devilish Feint

UvJdT9nuDSWWQ7kb.description: The Chelaxian fighter exhorts a faltering comrade with a stern word. The Chelaxian fighter attempts an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check against the Will DC of one ally within 30 feet. On a success, the target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is reduced by 2, and the Chelaxian fighter can attempt to counteract one mental effect that ally is suffering from with a [[/r 1d20+17 #Counteract]]{+17} counteract modifier. On a critical success, the Chelaxian fighter also reduces the frightened condition of each other ally in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the target by 1.

YmlswdyaBq4Tz5j4.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian weaponmaster's last action was a Strike that hit an opponent

Effect The Chelaxian weaponmaster twists their blade and pushes with their shield to create an opening in the required opponent's defenses. That opponent takes a –2 status penalty to their AC against the next Strike made against them before the start of the Chelaxian weaponmaster's next turn. While this penalty lasts, the Chelaxian weaponmaster gains an additional reaction they can only use to make a Reactive Strike against the penalized opponent.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IPfr5O7bTwJhRB5v]{Effect: Create Opening}
YmlswdyaBq4Tz5j4.name: Create Opening

Cleansing Pool.description: The swirling water in this pool entices anyone who can see or hear it to wander into its depths, drowning its victims.
Cleansing Pool.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:24] to scratch out the runes creating the effect, @Check[occultism|dc:20] (expert) or @Check[Demon Lore|dc:20] (expert) to determine the password that identifies the party as believers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd-rank; counteract DC 22); two total successes are required to deactivate the pool.
Cleansing Pool.hazardRoutine:
(1 action; mental) The cleansing pool uses its first action to try and compel all creatures within 5 feet to enter into the pool. Creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is immune to the pool's routine for 1 minute.

Success No effect.

Failure The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} condition and attempts to enter the pool.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must also use all of their actions on their next turn to try and pull one of their allies into the pool with them.
Cleansing Pool.name: Cleansing Pool

Concentrated Congealed Magic.description:
Tomb jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, gray, and black hues. Their acidic bodies dissolve flesh but leave other materials, including a victim's gear and bones, intact. Some ancient cultures entombed bodies in stone sarcophagi with tomb jellies to allow the ooze to break down the flesh and clean and polish the bones.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

A872unbEeSXWQvTn.description: A creature hit by concentrated congealed magic's pseudopod takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. If the creature dies while it has this persistent damage, its corpse is affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest}, except the concentrated congealed magic can still dissolve its flesh.
A872unbEeSXWQvTn.name: Shadow Curse

BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.description: The concentrated congealed magic splatters some of its substance on a willing undead creature within its reach. The target regains @Damage[5[healing,void]|shortLabel] HP, and its melee Strikes get the benefits of shadow curse until the end of its next turn.
BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.name: Bound in Death

rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.description: A tomb jelly can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.name: Motion Sense

snySLSbjtHjATjFS.description: A tomb jelly's acid damages only flesh.
snySLSbjtHjATjFS.name: Flesh-dissolving Acid

Concentrated Congealed Magic.name: Concentrated Congealed Magic

Congealed Magic.description:
Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering, slug-like ropes of slime continuously scour their domain for food. In addition to their shape, they are named for their ability to shoot out expanding ribbons of slime that resemble tangled strings.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

LIfeVtjLRBsBRIF5.description: Congealed magic can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
LIfeVtjLRBsBRIF5.name: Motion Sense

UlW5OHvaMswBBNb1.description: Whenever a congealed magic would take slashing damage (if it weren't immune) and has at least 10 HP, it splits into two identical oozes with half the original's HP. One congealed magic is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, move smaller creatures and objects out of the way to make a space or the split is canceled at the GM's discretion.
UlW5OHvaMswBBNb1.name: Split

txSoRn67SYcT0oVZ.description:
Requirements another congealed magic is within 30 feet

Effect The ooze arcs magical essence to the other congealed magic. Creatures in that line take @Damage[3d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save. A creature that fails its save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
txSoRn67SYcT0oVZ.name: Tag Team

Congealed Magic.name: Congealed Magic

Crushing Crowd (1-2).description: The crowd rushes forward, risking a stampede as everyone tries to fnd a safe exit.
Crushing Crowd (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:15] to calm the crowd, or @Check[intimidation|dc:18] or @Check[society|dc:18] to control the crowd's behavior
Crushing Crowd (1-2).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the crowd moves 5 feet toward the exit in area A1, then crushes any creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage. All targets must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save.

Failure The target takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, becomes prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.
Crushing Crowd (1-2).name: Crushing Crowd (1-2)

Crushing Crowd (3-4).description: The crowd rushes forward, risking a stampede as everyone tries to fnd a safe exit.
Crushing Crowd (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:18] to calm the crowd, or @Check[intimidation|dc:21] or @Check[society|dc:21] to control the crowd's behavior
Crushing Crowd (3-4).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the crowd moves 5 feet toward the exit in area A1, then crushes any creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[(4d6)[bludgeoning]] damage. All targets must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save.

Failure The target takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, becomes prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.
Crushing Crowd (3-4).name: Crushing Crowd (3-4)

VTtnqCB7pHtTrVJJ.description:
A cybernetic zombie must use this reaction unless its cybernetics are disabled

Trigger The cybernetic zombie is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The zombie's damaged cybernetics explode, dealing @Damage[(2d8+2)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot radius} (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect] save). This ability destroys any technological items on the zombie.
VTtnqCB7pHtTrVJJ.name: Self Destruct

YQi4pEcsJfon1nS3.description: The cybernetics of a cybernetic zombie can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=15]] check. A zombie's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A cybernetic zombie with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions (including self-destruct).
YQi4pEcsJfon1nS3.name: Cybernetics

8eumTeww6536avGC.description:
Requirements The gargarthezul is on the deck of a ship.

Effect The gargarthezul swings from a nearby rope, moving up to twice its Speed and ignoring any terrain or lack of surface beneath it. It can make a tentacle Strike at any point during this movement.
8eumTeww6536avGC.name: Halyard Swing

QlktgKrcecMqG2Sa.description:
Requirements The gargarthezul's last action was a successful tentacle Strike.

Effect The gargarthezul places a brand on the creature it hit that fills the creature's mind with overwhelming urges towards piracy. The creature doesn't treat anyone as their ally and can't Delay or Ready. They must use all of their actions to attempt to Disarm, or Demoralize, targeting a creature randomly determined by the GM (they may use actions to facilitate their attempts, such as to move to the target or to drop an item so they have a free hand). The duration is based on a @Check[will|dc:19] save. If the creature successfully Disarms or Demoralizes their target, they can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] check to recover from Mark of Avarice. The gargarthezul may only have one mark of avarice in effect at any given time. An additional mark placed causes the previous one to fade.

Critical Success The creature becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The mark lasts for 1 round.

Critical Failure The mark lasts for 1 minute.
QlktgKrcecMqG2Sa.name: Mark of Avarice

X6hOrjB6TIyhyMQ5.description: A gargarthezul can't stand to be shown up. The first time each round a creature successfully Demoralizes, Shoves, or Trips a gargarthezul, it takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.
X6hOrjB6TIyhyMQ5.name: Bravado Aversion

jKfNuCn6j4e1lsfR.description:
When a gargarthezul successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} a foe, it gains 1d6 temporary Hit Points (2d6 on a critical success) that last for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.P8LdA05tK20u98MF]{Effect: Vicious Bluster}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Ty2YFxv2EDBOSjxl]{Effect: Vicious Bluster (Critical Success)}
jKfNuCn6j4e1lsfR.name: Vicious Bluster

yRpNZFLbeUdqHQ8H.description: The gargarthezul @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves} a creature, and Strides after it into the nearest adjacent square if successful. It then makes a tentacle Strike against the creature, using the same multiple attack penalty.
yRpNZFLbeUdqHQ8H.name: Bully

Damned Vescavor Swarm.description:
The most common and numerous vescavors are the raving swarms. If left alone and unchecked, many believe they would eventually consume themselves once everything else in the immediate vicinity was consumed. What is even more vexing than their hunger is their song. While it sounds like gibberish at first, once bitten, the song will drive people into chaos.

These gluttonous green vermin travel from the Outer Rifts in an endless search for food. Along the way, these acrid wasps devour everything in sight. Not even the ground itself is spared from their appetite. While any single vescavor is no problem, they travel in swarms to overwhelm anything trying to stop them. In a truly unfortunate situation, several swarms will be gathered and led by a vescavor queen. These queens, while fearsome on their own, can drive their brood into a feeding rage unlike any other. Swarms found without a queen are directionless, destroying anything around them indiscriminately.

Whenever a vescavor swarm is not eating, it gibbers mind-numbing songs from the fiends' dark world. Adapted to the shrieking jungles of their home plane, they issue a call that confuses and corrupts mortals.

Philosophers who ponder the Outer Rifts often conjecture as to what kind of soul forms a vescavor. The idea of insect souls being sent to the Outer Rifts is often laughed off but never entirely dismissed. Some assume that they are demons of gluttony, plain and simple. Some of the more creative explanations of vescavor origins posit that all the bits of soul eaten up by attacking demons are what coalesce into these endless swarms. Such an explanation would account for how these endlessly feeding demons also seem to be endless in number.

1IPpNFHT1dgYNnrz.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(3d6+2)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.
1IPpNFHT1dgYNnrz.name: Ravenous Bites

4yvGfMCIeRQHkhLP.description:
Each stupefied creature in the swarm's space must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] saving throw as the swarm yammers the endless chorus of the Outer Rifts.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Maddening Gibbers for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected and is immune to Maddening Gibbers for 1 round.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target becomes confused for 1 round and can't target demons while confused in this way.
4yvGfMCIeRQHkhLP.name: Maddening Gibbers

9he851OaVPSpTPTg.description: The swarm eat away the very earth beneath their feet. The swarms Strides. All squares they occupy during their movement becomes difficult terrain. Any creatures they move through must succeed a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
9he851OaVPSpTPTg.name: Devour All

Damned Vescavor Swarm.name: Damned Vescavor Swarm

SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.description:
Trigger An enemy in this creature's champion's aura damages them

Effect This creature gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, regardless of damage type. In addition, their Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra spirit damage until the end of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.h6nyMp4dtPXBfCJc]{Effect: Selfish Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2a6fuugiPpICe3Li]{Effect: Champion's Extra Damage}
SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.name: Selfish Shield

wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.description: When the champion of Deskari critically succeeds at a Strike against an enemy with their scythe, their enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and moved 5 feet in the direction of the champion's choice. This is forced movement.
wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.name: Powerful Faith

Decked-Out Appraiser.description:
Neither human nor beast yet resembling both, yeongno (yeong-no) are creatures that once were denizens of heaven but were cast out, down to the mortal Universe, due to their own greed. Yeongno claim to have once been celestial dragons and wear elongated dragon masks with full-body wraps decorated with scale patterns in honor of this claim—though no one has been able to confirm the veracity of this belief. As they wander, they hold a willow pipe in their mouths, producing a distinct "bibi" sound that often heralds their appearance.

Despite their reputation as monsters who eat people, yeongno are welcomed by the poor and oppressed, who see the creatures as wise and just. Yeongno believe that by eating 100 wealthy individuals who abuse their wealth or who accumulated their wealth by underhanded or exploitative means, they can atone for their own greed, allowing them to ascend back into heaven. A corrupt and greedy individual can escape their fate of being eaten by a yeongno by giving away all of their wealth and agreeing to be transformed into a pig for one year. If the person can endure one year living as a pig in the care of a household they once harmed, the yeongno will spare them.

6eug6ysw8yCw92jm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect A target creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis}, being polymorphed into a pig whose girth is determined by the target's wealth. After 24 hours, the target can end this effect using a Dismiss action, at which point the yeongno becomes aware that the effect has ended. A yeongno can use Fortune's Favor only if no targets are currently under its effects.
6eug6ysw8yCw92jm.name: Fortune's Favor

nHkmmECcNb37nfCM.description: The yeongno can detect the presence, location, and approximate value of gold within 120 feet.
nHkmmECcNb37nfCM.name: Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet

pO7jeDvpQCsZJiE4.description:
Requirements The target is carrying at least 100 gp worth of precious metals

Effect The yeongno crushes a creature it can see with the weight of their wealth. Apparitions of gold coins approximating the wealth of the target materialize and pummel the target from all sides. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[3d8[persistent,mental]] damage and is slowed 1 as long as the damage continues. The effect immediately ends if they're carrying less than 100 gp worth of precious metals.

Critical Failure As failure, except any flat checks to remove the persistent damage automatically fail.
pO7jeDvpQCsZJiE4.name: Money is Pain

Decked-Out Appraiser.name: Decked-Out Appraiser

LQwIeFmRujywT6zT.description:
Trigger An enemy enters into melee range of Minister Jo

Frequency once per hour

Effect Minister Jo is not a fighter and would prefer to be safely behind his bodyguards. He flees, Striding up to his Speed, and he must end his movement closer to the Appraiser than when he started. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, he can Reload his sukgung and then fire it backward over his shoulder in a panic, attempting a sukgung Strike against the triggering creature.
LQwIeFmRujywT6zT.name: Cowardly Flight

b9FQMGhETCHSDlXK.description:
Requirements Minister Jo has expensive bolts

Effect Minister Jo supplements his mediocre fighting ability with a variety of cheaply sourced magical items. He Reloads his sukgung with an expensive bolt and activates its magic, imbuing his next sukgung Strike with one of the following effects.

  • Shuffling Bolt (teleportation) If the bolt hits a target, the target and Minister Jo swap places. If the triggering hit was a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round after the teleportation.
  • Snare Bolt If the bolt hits a target, silk webbing wraps around them, imposing a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, or until they [[/act escape dc=23]] against a DC of 23. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes.
  • Spark Bolt (electricity) The bolt deals an additional @Damage[(2d12[splash])[electricity]] damage.
b9FQMGhETCHSDlXK.name: Expensive Reload

6jIvPGI89DjHhbbB.description: The manifestation of nightmare deals @Damage[(2d6+9)[mental]] damage to any number of creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure.
6jIvPGI89DjHhbbB.name: Constrict Mind

G2oXTAPyRAALRTFA.description: A manifestation of nightmare can form up to 8 morphic limbs at the same time. These limbs are constantly shifting their features according to the manifestation's whims, becoming fists, claws, pincers, blades, and anything else that it can imagine.
G2oXTAPyRAALRTFA.name: Morphic Limb

IT0KNDfWpGkEg7VM.description: If the manifestation of nightmare critically hits with a nightmare vision Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.
IT0KNDfWpGkEg7VM.name: Unnerving Echo

RwOpOaB417q5eIKE.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature that is being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by a manifestation of nightmare can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 until it Escapes.
RwOpOaB417q5eIKE.name: Recurring Nightmare

Demon Ark.description: A demonic presence animates the ship carrying demon pirates.
Demon Ark.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:23] (trained) to ward against demonic presence, @Check[arcana|dc:23] (trained) or @Check[occultism|dc:23] (trained) to weaken the demonic possession, @Check[intimidation|dc:23] (trained) to scare it away, or @Check[sailing-lore|dc:21] (trained) to confuse it; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Demon Ark.hazardRoutine:
2 The demon ark uses its actions on one of the following options (GM's choice). It loses one action from its routine if a PC succeeds at an attempt to Disable it or it reaches its Broken Threshold.

  • Broadside Blast a The demon ark makes a Chthonian cannon Strike.
  • Demonic List d Effect The ship tosses and turns. Each creature in the hazard's area must make a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save. On a failure, it is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; on a critical failure it also takes @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Heads Will Roll a It makes a bowsprit Strike.
  • Sea Chantey a (auditory) All fiends within 60 feet gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects; all non-fiends within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:auditory] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.GAuA1XLLO4vkF3OJ]{Effect: Sea Chantey}
Demon Ark.name: Demon Ark
