  • Demonic List d Effect The ship tosses and turns. Each creature in the hazard's area must make a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save. On a failure, it is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; on a critical failure it also takes @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Heads Will Roll a It makes a bowsprit Strike.
  • Sea Chantey a (auditory) All fiends within 60 feet gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects; all non-fiends within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:auditory] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.GAuA1XLLO4vkF3OJ]{Effect: Sea Chantey}
Demon Ship.name: Demon Ship

Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin.description:
The bottlenose dolphin is the most common and widespread species of dolphin. They are social predators who hunt shallow seas and rivers in large family groups called pods. Sailors are fond of bottlenose dolphins and frequently tell of how they've saved drowning mariners or protected crew from sharks with blows from their powerful snouts.

Dolphins encompass a wide range of aquatic mammals, all of which are social, intelligent, and widespread throughout the world's oceans.

TBp1tYUPtYoOEonO.description: A bottlenose dolphin can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.
TBp1tYUPtYoOEonO.name: Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet

jN9qLXiQfaOBlFfC.description:
The bottlenose dolphin @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swims} twice and then makes a snout Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

A Large or smaller creature hit by this attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.
jN9qLXiQfaOBlFfC.name: Ramming Speed

khgGPSxgTQcgev3o.description: A bottlenose dolphin can hold its breath for 2 hours.
khgGPSxgTQcgev3o.name: Deep Breath

Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin.name: Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin

Demonic Ocean Drake.description:
Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the dragons that rule the oceans. While smaller than most drakes, river drakes are more than capable of plaguing river travelers and are equally at home above and below the water's surface. This flexibility allows them to catch a wide variety of prey, from fish and boggards to deer and the occasional ferry passenger.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.description: The river drake makes one Fangs Strike and two Tail Strikes in any order.
GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.name: Draconic Frenzy

jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the ocean drake's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect The ocean drake attempts to Strike the triggering creature with its tail. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}
jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.name: Tail Lash

qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The river drake Strides or Flies twice.
qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.name: Speed Surge

xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.description:
The ocean drake spits a ball of chthonic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,spirit]] and take a -5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent spirit damage.

The ocean drake can't use Chthonic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Chthonic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.uZ2mAwpVz1bkw5GK]{Effect: Chthonic Mucus}
xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.name: Chthonic Mucus

Demonic Ocean Drake.name: Demonic Ocean Drake

QfNrL6zigLO2I2bc.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)
QfNrL6zigLO2I2bc.name: Abyssal Poison

b4ifDWvVrCkuR9IA.description: The drone of the derakni's wings mesmerizes listeners. The derakni Flies. All creatures within 20 feet of the derakni at any point during this movement must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] saving throw. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (3 rounds on a critical failure); on a success, the target is immune for 1 minute.
b4ifDWvVrCkuR9IA.name: Droning Flyby

2mKzRScUK1wQ3NKq.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing],2d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any creature that failures its saving throw also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
2mKzRScUK1wQ3NKq.name: Acidic Swarm

3bZlb8W3112ozsBC.description: Oloranvis has an unusually strong connection to winter magic even for a winter witch. When she casts a spell with the cold trait, she gains a +1 status bonus to the spell DC or spell attack.
3bZlb8W3112ozsBC.name: Winter's Gift

TwYtLCynQGJg3nk1.description: Oloranvis's familiar is a poppet elkhound named Ruditgar. His Speed is 40 feet. He has poppet immunities and weakness 4 to fire. When Oloranvis Casts or Sustains a hex, she can cause ice to form in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] centered on Ruditgar's square. Those squares are difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. Ruditgar and Oloranvis communicate telepathically through touch.
TwYtLCynQGJg3nk1.name: Familiar

dxArJTSJ6RRIxiw7.description: Oloranvis's razor-sharp nails sparkle with the residue of her winter magic. Her unarmed nail strikes cause both cold and slashing damage.
dxArJTSJ6RRIxiw7.name: Eldritch Nails

2AazzXyHKMk4CBqa.description: The disciple raises their heavy crimson cloak, providing them with a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC and also giving them access to the Snagging Catch reaction.
2AazzXyHKMk4CBqa.name: Cloak and Dagger

BuPJNWPun4flCMBD.description:
Requirements The disciple has their crimson cloak raised

Trigger The disciple is attacked by a melee weapon

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, the disciple attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the triggering weapon, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus. The cloak is destroyed after this action.
BuPJNWPun4flCMBD.name: Snagging Catch

kT4mJsqHWAdlpSzN.description: The disciple's strikes deal 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the disciple's allies.
kT4mJsqHWAdlpSzN.name: Pattern Attack

kT4mJsqHWAdlpSzN.name: Pattern Attack

9IQj88Hkj1UAEeaG.description: When it is first encountered, the divine oozeshard is in a lumpy, vaguely spherical ooze form. When it takes damage from any weapon attack, it suddenly reshapes, taking a form almost identical to the dead deity Gorum. The ooze hardens into armored plates (increasing its AC by +8) and its pseudopod transforms into a massive, acid-dripping greatsword. While in this form, it loses its pseudopod attack and its immunity to bludgeoning and precision damage. It cannot use its constrict or engulf abilities, and any creature currently engulfed by it is spat out into an adjacent random square, taking @Damage[1d8[acid],1d8[slashing]]{1d8 acid damage and 1d8 slashing} damage. It gains the Reactive Strike reaction. If it is critically hit by a Strike or critically fails a save against an effect that deals Hit Point damage to it, the divine oozeshard reverts back into its ooze form.
9IQj88Hkj1UAEeaG.name: Armored Apotheosis

QEOgW56JFwhtqtP4.description: Whenever the divine oozeshard takes 55 or more damage from a single attack, it spawns a sparking oozeshardling node in an adjacent square. The sparking oozeshardling node's electric pulse reaction immediately activates and then the sparking oozeshardling node enters initiative at the bottom of the current initiative count.
QEOgW56JFwhtqtP4.name: Spawn Oozeshardling Node

tywbosK5iMu0FmPc.description: While in its armored apotheosis form, the divine oozeshard deals an additional 1d8 bleed damage and makes the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round whenever it critically hits with its greatsword.
tywbosK5iMu0FmPc.name: Gorumite Echoes

Divine Oozeshardling Node.description: A lump of bluish ooze shot through with what look like tiny silver shavings of metal. Once it has been activated, it glows with arcs of electricity that leap out at nearby targets.
Divine Oozeshardling Node.hazardDisable: Two successful @Check[arcana|dc:25] or @Check[occultism|dc:25] (trained) checks on the oozeshardling to disperse its power, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:27] or @Check[thievery|dc:27] (expert) to remove the flecks of empowering warshard from within the oozeshardling. A failed Acrobatics or Thievery check to disable an oozeshardling results in the creature attempting the check taking @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage (@Damage[2d6[acid]] on a critical failure).
Divine Oozeshardling Node.hazardReset: The oozeshardling node collapses and melds back into the oozeshard after 1 minute, or disappears entirely if the oozeshard is slain.
Divine Oozeshardling Node.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The oozeshardling uses its first action to make an electric spark Strike against one random non-ooze creature within range, its second action is used to move straight in a random cardinal direction (roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Direction]] to determine the direction), and its third action to make a second electric spark Strike against a different random non-ooze creature within range. The oozeshardling doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Divine Oozeshardling Node.name: Divine Oozeshardling Node

Doldrums Bud Pile.description: Doldrum heaps that have only started to grow have no intelligence, but are incredibly tenacious and can reflexively grab onto nearby prey. They obtain nutrients by drowning prey in the water they grow in.
Doldrums Bud Pile.hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:35] (expert) to rip the reflexive tendrils off the bud or @Check[thievery|dc:35] (expert) to trigger the tendrils beforehand and keep them occupied.
Doldrums Bud Pile.hazardReset: 1 hour if the bud pile has something in its grasps. 1 round if the bud pile has nothing in its grasps.
Doldrums Bud Pile.name: Doldrums Bud Pile

Dread Leshy Ghoul.description: Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.
7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.name: Consume Flesh

Eio9qRZi4Wxz6XXD.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The ghoul calls upon knowledge it retains from one creature it has consumed in the past 7 days. The ghoul attempts a skill check using a skill in which the consumed creature was trained (if it's unclear whether the creature was trained, the GM decides). The ghoul is treated as trained and uses the high skill modifier for the ghoul's level. This takes the same amount of actions or time as usual for the check.

The ghoul can instead automatically learn something specific known by a creature it consumed in the last 7 days, like the location of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} treasure or the name of a loved one. The ghoul can do this only once for a given creature, no matter how much of its flesh the ghoul consumed.
Eio9qRZi4Wxz6XXD.name: Grave Knowledge

OUwIUuX3HFB69lSp.description:
The leshy ghoul transforms into a Small giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Q56uznjD6F3ZIrgi.description: When a leshy ghoul dies, a burst of twisted primal void energy explodes from its body, restoring @Damage[2d8[healing,void]]{2d8} Hit Points to each undead fungi or plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] and killing all natural plants, though merely causing discomfort to creatures with the plant trait. This area is filled with rotten vegetation, becoming difficult terrain.
Q56uznjD6F3ZIrgi.name: Rotten Burst

jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed},@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.
jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.name: Ghoul Whispers

kJUApzF9beBQy9ZK.description: A leshy ghoul can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungus creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage] damage. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet.
kJUApzF9beBQy9ZK.name: Spore Cloud

pYrkU7D0zEWCIPMB.description:
A creature can still eat and drink while sickened by this curse

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]|immutable] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4
pYrkU7D0zEWCIPMB.name: Forbidden Cravings

rnZiI5m7zQDyQeSG.description: A creature that takes damage from a fungus leshy's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.
rnZiI5m7zQDyQeSG.name: Spores

Dread Leshy Ghoul.name: Dread Leshy Ghoul

Dread Zombie Leshy.description:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

H3MTa5QRWIyjB4Ns.description: When a zombie leshy dies, a burst of twisted primal void energy explodes from its body, restoring @Damage[1d8[healing,void]]{1d8} Hit Points to each undead fungi or plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] and killing all natural plants, though merely causing discomfort to creatures with the plant trait. This area is filled with rotten vegetation, becoming difficult terrain.
H3MTa5QRWIyjB4Ns.name: Rotten Burst

RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes form zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately, or a zombie leshy if the creature had the leshy trait.
RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.name: Zombie Rot

a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.description: A zombie leshy is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions
a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.name: Slow

y6NWs2vf0hhJLFls.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.
y6NWs2vf0hhJLFls.name: Jaws

zesKW21Ox2xprY6R.description: The zombie leshy glides gently through the air, moving 5 feet toward the ground and up to 25 feet forward. As long as the leshy spends at least 1 action gliding each round, it remains in the air at the end of each turn. For the purpose of determining damage from falls, a leaf leshy always treats falls as if they were 20 feet shorter.
zesKW21Ox2xprY6R.name: Glide

Dread Zombie Leshy.name: Dread Zombie Leshy

Dread Zombie Leshy Horde.description:
This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

YNpN5FwvZ27Zfviz.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leshy zombies lash out at any enemies in their squares or within 5 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+5)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(1d12+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
YNpN5FwvZ27Zfviz.name: Shambling Onslaught

ck37LN0pcQmPLf0a.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.
ck37LN0pcQmPLf0a.name: Troop Movement

xb36ZcB5nu2McDrU.description: The zombie leshy horde is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.
xb36ZcB5nu2McDrU.name: Grave Tide

yQzN4wExqO58Ssdr.description: A zombie leshy horde is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions
yQzN4wExqO58Ssdr.name: Slow

Dread Zombie Leshy Horde.name: Dread Zombie Leshy Horde

Earth Falls (1-2).description: The area has become unstable as part of the swamp is pulled into another plane, causing sinkholes to spontaneously form.
Earth Falls (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana,nature,thievery|dc:15] (trained) two times to counter the planar energies.
Earth Falls (1-2).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) On its turn each round, two new 10-foot-square sinkholes, 5 feet deep, randomly appear on the map. Until a creature of size Small or larger steps in the area of one, it looks no different than the surrounding area. If a creature takes an action to seek and succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:15] check, it notices the hazardous square.
Earth Falls (1-2).name: Earth Falls (1-2)

Earth Falls (3-4).description: The area has become unstable as part of the swamp is pulled into another plane, causing sinkholes to spontaneously form.
Earth Falls (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana,nature,thievery|dc:18] (trained) three times to counter the planar energies.
Earth Falls (3-4).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) On its turn each round, two new 10-foot-square sinkholes, 10 feet deep, randomly appear on the map. Until a creature of size Small or larger steps in the area of one, it looks no different than the surrounding area. If a creature takes an action to seek and succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:18] check, it notices the hazardous square.
Earth Falls (3-4).name: Earth Falls (3-4)

Earthquake.description: The earth shakes violently side to side, opening a fissure in the ground, partially collapsing builds, and scattering debris in all directions.
Earthquake.name: Earthquake

Earthquake (13-14).description: The earth shakes violently side to side, opening a fissure in the ground, partially collapsing builds, and scattering debris in all directions.
Earthquake (13-14).name: Earthquake (13-14)

6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.description:
The elegecide lashes out with its trailing dorsal fins, looping them around a target within 15 feet. It sends a burst of telepathic information about all the possible ways the target can be injured in the next minute. The target takes @Damage[1d4[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the elegecide.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the elegecide.
6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.name: Dorsal Lash

9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.description: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.
9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.name: Telepathy (100 feet)

prtTIT0LyapARhoz.description: The elegecide is fueled by the certainty of doom, which leaves it weakened by any hope. The first time each round that a creature critically fails at an attack or skill check against the elegecide, it experiences a burst of hope that leaves it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
prtTIT0LyapARhoz.name: Hope Vulnerability

y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.description:
30 feet

The elegecide constantly emits telepathic warnings about future dangers and harm. When a non-demon creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).
y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.name: Doom Aura

Elite Air Scamp.description:
A pale blue head and paper-thin wings peek out from the cloud that clings to the air scamp. Air scamps are short-sighted and flighty, even relative to their kin; they are as likely to fly recklessly into battle as they are to whine in terror at a loud noise.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

1CENtBTrhih9EKVU.description: The air scamp ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.
1CENtBTrhih9EKVU.name: Fog Vision

yC1vWH3Q9V6GoICd.description:
The air scamp creates cutting winds in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deal @Damage[(2d6+4)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed back 10 feet.

The air scamp can't use Sirocco Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sirocco Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
yC1vWH3Q9V6GoICd.name: Sirocco Breath

Elite Air Scamp.name: Elite Air Scamp

Elite Animated Flame.description:
Although arguably quite friendly, fire scamps are considered far more dangerous than their kin. They delight in fire and playing pranks on everyone they befriend. Even given time to understand others' dislike of fire, most fire scamps enjoy the feel of flames enough to constantly test their limits.

Compared to the nations of other scamps, the nations on the Plane of Fire are by far the strongest. This backing inspires fire scamps to challenge authority more quickly than the others.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

JPfXLDy2dYseqUop.description: The animated flame ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
JPfXLDy2dYseqUop.name: Smoke Vision

UnZj5Xyb8m8zt4Wk.description:
Trigger The animated flame leaves the village

Effect The animated flame becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.
UnZj5Xyb8m8zt4Wk.name: Failing Task

gMRZ46sjaLERrmao.description:
The animated flame breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[(2d4+4)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

The animated flame can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
gMRZ46sjaLERrmao.name: Flame Breath

yAvraJf1ksBAcCOl.description:
Trigger The animated flame starts its turn outside the village

Effect The animated flame dissipates.
yAvraJf1ksBAcCOl.name: Failed Task

Elite Animated Flame.name: Elite Animated Flame

Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic.description:
Tomb jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, gray, and black hues. Their acidic bodies dissolve flesh but leave other materials, including a victim's gear and bones, intact. Some ancient cultures entombed bodies in stone sarcophagi with tomb jellies to allow the ooze to break down the flesh and clean and polish the bones.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

A872unbEeSXWQvTn.description: A creature hit by concentrated congealed magic's pseudopod takes @Damage[(1d6-2)[persistent,void]] damage. If the creature dies while it has this persistent damage, its corpse is affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest}, except the concentrated congealed magic can still dissolve its flesh.
A872unbEeSXWQvTn.name: Shadow Curse

BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.description: The concentrated congealed magic splatters some of its substance on a willing undead creature within its reach. The target regains @Damage[3[healing,void]|shortLabel] HP, and its melee Strikes get the benefits of shadow curse until the end of its next turn.
BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.name: Bound in Death

rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.description: A tomb jelly can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.name: Motion Sense

snySLSbjtHjATjFS.description: A tomb jelly's acid damages only flesh.
snySLSbjtHjATjFS.name: Flesh-dissolving Acid

Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic.name: Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic

Elite Congealed Magic.description:
Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering, slug-like ropes of slime continuously scour their domain for food. In addition to their shape, they are named for their ability to shoot out expanding ribbons of slime that resemble tangled strings.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

LIfeVtjLRBsBRIF5.description: Congealed magic can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
LIfeVtjLRBsBRIF5.name: Motion Sense

UlW5OHvaMswBBNb1.description: Whenever a congealed magic would take slashing damage (if it weren't immune) and has at least 10 HP, it splits into two identical oozes with half the original's HP. One congealed magic is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, move smaller creatures and objects out of the way to make a space or the split is canceled at the GM's discretion.
UlW5OHvaMswBBNb1.name: Split

txSoRn67SYcT0oVZ.description:
Requirements another congealed magic is within 30 feet

Effect The ooze arcs magical essence to the other congealed magic. Creatures in that line take @Damage[(3d6-2)[void]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save. A creature that fails its save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
txSoRn67SYcT0oVZ.name: Tag Team

Elite Congealed Magic.name: Elite Congealed Magic

Elite Ghoul Stalker (PFS 6-99).description:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.name: Consume Flesh

Eio9qRZi4Wxz6XXD.description:
[[/r 1d20+9]]{+9} skill modifier

Frequency once per hour

Effect The ghoul calls upon knowledge it retains from one creature it has consumed in the past 7 days. The ghoul attempts a skill check using a skill in which the consumed creature was trained (if it's unclear whether the creature was trained, the GM decides). The ghoul is treated as trained and uses the high skill modifier for the ghoul's level. This takes the same amount of actions or time as usual for the check.

The ghoul can instead automatically learn something specific known by a creature it consumed in the last 7 days, like the location of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} treasure or the name of a loved one. The ghoul can do this only once for a given creature, no matter how much of its flesh the ghoul consumed.
Eio9qRZi4Wxz6XXD.name: Grave Knowledge

jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.

Forbidden Cravings (curse) A creature can still eat and drink while sickened by this curse

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:19|traits:curse]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat;

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4
jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.name: Ghoul Whispers

rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.name: Swift Leap

Elite Ghoul Stalker (PFS 6-99).name: Elite Ghoul Stalker (PFS 6-99)

Elite Shadow (PFS 6-99).description: The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

0QWVJ7Of8cQNKp0N.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.
0QWVJ7Of8cQNKp0N.name: Slink in Shadows

0Qt9ULbGzJV8ZG3W.description:
When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.clzHAfegb9Rn6DOe]{Shadow Spawn} doesn't have Steal Shadow and is perpetually and incurably @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.
0Qt9ULbGzJV8ZG3W.name: Shadow Spawn

ACHlnYzXVxizzqPw.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).
ACHlnYzXVxizzqPw.name: Light Vulnerability

Kjifw1jgDvfmrEGU.description:
Requirements The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from Steal Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.
Kjifw1jgDvfmrEGU.name: Steal Shadow

Elite Shadow (PFS 6-99).name: Elite Shadow (PFS 6-99)

DyXTFnUImaBRP7NF.description: A Silver Devil hooligan deals 1d6 additional damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} opponent.

tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.description: Silver Devil hooligans benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil hooligans are adjacent to that creature.
tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.name: Gang Up

Elite Wood Scamp.description:
These moss colonies coalesce over a century into the rough facsimile of a large sloth, right down to mimicking the unique structure of the animal's fur that attracts additional fungi and pollinating insects. Unless summoned or attacked, they rarely leave the trees upon which they first formed.

At first glance, wood elementals might not seem to have the same destructive potential as their cousins from the Planes of Fire, Water, or Air, but don't be fooled. The woods can be a dangerous place.

Though some resemble animals, the elemental beasts presented here are still plants, and their life cycles reflect it. Vegetable lambs grow on rooted stalks, from which they can't be removed until they've matured (or perhaps ripened), leaving them dependent on their immediate surroundings for food. Moss sloths are little more than lumps of green fluff for the first century of their existence, only gaining limited mobility once they can grow their defensive wooden claws.

Wild But Unwild

Many wood elementals are created by kizidhars and other powerful creatures on the Plane of Wood and placed in rote roles. Populating nature preserves and sprawling estates, they can be unsure how to behave if released into the wild. They're essentially born domesticated and will likely act far differently than the wild creatures they mimic, even in natural environments. Their natural predators are few, putting the elementals at less risk, although they're still sometimes eaten by giant termites or captured by some as pets.

A Brain By Any Other Name

Even if Lady Shumunue taught the wood elementals' ancestors to mimic animals, a wood elemental's consciousness is contained not in a brain but in its root system. Entities like nursery crawlers, living groves, and carved beasts use this to their advantage. That an elemental's wooden body can be carved and crafted, apparently without lasting harm, implies that they might not feel pain so long as their roots remain undamaged.

OkAkqlgDi1isALeF.description: The wood scamp breathes choking pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[(2d6+4)[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save; creatures who don't need to breathe are immune). The wood scamp can't Breathe Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Pollen]]{1d4 rounds}.
OkAkqlgDi1isALeF.name: Breathe Pollen

cDhKXGyP6SctggAU.description: The wood scamp breaks off one of its thorn-like claws in the target's skin, dealing 1 persistent bleed damage until the thorn is removed, which requires an Interact action. This damage is cumulative with each thorn caught in a creature's skin.
cDhKXGyP6SctggAU.name: Thorn Puncture

Elite Wood Scamp.name: Elite Wood Scamp

Empowered Bloodmoon.description: Bloodmoon is a naginata that can act on its own provided it is attuned to at least one creature.
Empowered Bloodmoon.hazardDisable: Two successful @Check[religion|dc:17|options:disable-bloodmoon] or @Check[occultism|dc:17|options:disable-bloodmoon] checks, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 15)
Empowered Bloodmoon.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Bloodmoon uses its first action to fly up to 20 feet towards an opponent. It then makes two naginata strikes, each against a different foe.
Empowered Bloodmoon.name: Empowered Bloodmoon

Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).description: Bloodmoon is a naginata that can act on its own provided it is attuned to at least one creature.
Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).hazardDisable: Two successful @Check[religion|dc:20|options:disable-bloodmoon] or @Check[occultism|dc:20|options:disable-bloodmoon] checks, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18)
Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Bloodmoon uses its first action to fly up to 20 feet towards an opponent. It then makes two naginata strikes, each against a different foe.
Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4).name: Empowered Bloodmoon (3-4)

Empowered Oozeshardling Node.description: A lump of bluish ooze shot through with what look like tiny silver shavings of metal. Once it has been activated, it glows with arcs of electricity that leap out at nearby targets.
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.hazardDisable: Two successful @Check[arcana|dc:22] or @Check[occultism|dc:22] (trained) checks on the oozeshardling to disperse its power, or @Check[acrobatics|dc:24] or @Check[thievery|dc:24] (expert) to remove the flecks of empowering warshard from within the oozeshardling. A failed Acrobatics or Thievery check to disable an oozeshardling results in the creature attempting the check taking @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage (@Damage[2d6[acid]] on a critical failure).
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.hazardReset: The oozeshardling node collapses and melds back into the oozeshard after 1 minute, or disappears entirely if the oozeshard is slain.
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The oozeshardling uses its first action to make an electric spark Strike against one random non-ooze creature within range, its second action is used to move straight in a random cardinal direction (roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Direction]] to determine the direction), and its third action to make a second electric spark Strike against a different random non-ooze creature within range. The oozeshardling doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Empowered Oozeshardling Node.name: Empowered Oozeshardling Node

11SMR9i2SDGSrgtn.description:
Trigger Rowan has thrown her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ZvIEJCY60fHqzl6r]{Serpent Dagger} at a target

Frequency once per turn

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, Rowan yanks on the cord attached to the weapon's hilt, returning it to her hand. If she throws the weapon to a distance of 20 feet or beyond, this ability becomes 1-action and gains the manipulate trait.
11SMR9i2SDGSrgtn.name: Tether Pull

QC1C7qTJXeZS9gNQ.description:
Requirements Rowan is within 30 feet of one of the circular mirrors in the southern two rooms of the laboratory

Effect Rowan uses her connection to the aiudara fragments to translocate. She Strides once into one of the circular mirrors, teleporting to any other such mirror of her choice. When she does this, she leaves behind a mirrored image of herself until the start of her next turn. This image acts as an ally for all purposes, but has an AC of 0, 1 HP, and cannot take actions.
QC1C7qTJXeZS9gNQ.name: Mirror Step

cmGhYmv28lFbpAeV.description: Rowan's strikes deal 2d6 extra damage to creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her, or who are within reach of at least one of her allies.
cmGhYmv28lFbpAeV.name: Flash Attack

zO2ikCbhFzLOlWD1.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.
zO2ikCbhFzLOlWD1.name: +1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty Blows

PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.description: Shadow Lesolethe causes the shadows cast by those around her to transform into a mesh of blades which erupt upwards at her foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Enemy creatures in this area take @Damage[5d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save).
PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.name: Blades of Shade

vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.description: Shadow-Lesolethe utters a scream which causes shadows to churn and boil. Each living enemy within 30 feet to attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Boiling Darkness for 1 minute.
vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.name: Boiling Darkness

Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.description: A raging storm covers the mountain lake as spring water levitates from the lake to fall back down in a driving spiral of steaming rain. In the depths of the storm, barely visible, is a tiny koi egg surrounded by three bands of water.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:28], @Check[religion|dc:28], @Check[nature|dc:28], or @Check[occultism|dc:28] to purify the magic corrupting the ascension ritual, or @Check[diplomacy|dc:31] or @Check[performance|dc:31] to soothe the spirit within the koi egg and give it the strength to fight off the corruption itself; four total successes are required to purify the ritual, each of the first three successes purifying one ring of water and the final one halting the ritual itself. If the cursed comb has not been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check merely halts the ritual; if the cursed comb has been removed from the ritual site, then succeeding on this final check completes the ascension ritual.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.hazardReset: The turbulent koi egg can attempt to hatch again, restarting the ascension ritual, after 1000 years of Xalreonshin's care.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.hazardRoutine: (1 action) Torrential water descends from the sky, taking the shape of a dragon that smashes into one creature within 60 feet of the egg. The dragon always targets the creature that is closest to the egg, dealing @Damage[(2d10+2)[bludgeoning],2d10[fire]]{2d10+2 bludgeoning damage and 2d10 fire} damage in a spray of boiling water (@Check[fortitude|dc:28] save). Creatures that fail the save are pushed 10 feet away. Creatures that have the earth trait, are carrying an item with the earth trait, or are otherwise strongly tied to elemental earth (such as an earth elemental sorcerer or kineticist) get the result one degree of success better than the outcome of their save, as the power of elemental earth overcomes water.
Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg.name: Empowered Turbulent Koi Egg

1CUi9QEspSFb6L9m.description: Yollen's signature spellstrike channels the ill will of Hell. He casts ignition, then makes a melee attack strike with his greataxe. If he successfully hits, he deals an additional 3d6 damage (6d6 on a critical hit) on top of the damage from ignition and the greataxe. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not apply until after Yollen completes this ability. Yollen cannot use Hellish Spellstrike again until he has recharge it using a single action with the concentrate trait, or cast his conflux spell.
1CUi9QEspSFb6L9m.name: Hellish Spellstrike

d6UGxC2zRZHSEbJu.description:
Through his Nahyndrian-warshard concoction, Yollen voice becomes infused with the menacing weight of a tyrant devil. All non-allied creatures within 20 feet who can hear Yollen must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save against @Damage[7d10[spirit]] damage.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute. The creature must also attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute. The creature must also attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.
d6UGxC2zRZHSEbJu.name: Voice of the Nessari

Enava.description:
Succubi are manifestations of the sin of destructive lust, and they are the most attractive of all demons—as befits their role in seducing mortals to fall to sin. The concept of gender is fluid to a succubus, as they can adopt countless humanoid forms of any gender to aid in their goals. Most succubi have a feminine true form (incubi, which usually have a masculine true form, are a different kind of demon), but regardless of gender, a lust demon is supernaturally beautiful or handsome, but with curving horns, bat wings, sharp claws, and a sinuous tail.

When disguised as a mortal humanoid in the Universe, a succubus whispers into the ears of mortals, urging them to pursue their darkest and most destructive desires and pushing them into depravity, using magic only if persuasion fails. While mortals often fixate on succubi's application of sexual lust, these demons are can easily exploit lust for power, knowledge, fame, or any other desire as easily as more carnal appetites. Their ability to infiltrate societies makes them excellent spies, assassins, and political saboteurs as well. Ultimately, the succubus enjoys all means of upending mortal culture.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

NFPV2IK6zYWCTJbC.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The succubus engages a creature they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in an embrace or other act of passion to drain its vital essence.

The kiss makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained value by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and the succubus regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} to submit to more actions of passion rather than trying to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.
NFPV2IK6zYWCTJbC.name: Passionate Kiss

b3OSC1hy3efFqhm7.description:
10 feet.

Any creature in the aura that could be sexually attracted to a succubus takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to oppose the succubus's mental spells, Deception, and Diplomacy.
b3OSC1hy3efFqhm7.name: Seductive Presence

dK5Meg25B2t4B34g.description:
As succubi are beings of pure lust, creatures that reject their lust can metaphysically harm them. When a succubus fails a Diplomacy check to Embrace or Request, or when a creature succeeds at its save against a succubus's mental spell or ability, the succubus takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage.

For 1 hour after causing mental damage to a succubus in this way, a creature can deal @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage to the succubus with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action incorporating its rejection.
dK5Meg25B2t4B34g.name: Rejection Vulnerability

ghngQIhTKh6viVvP.description:
The succubus can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

vgbSuZiK389nv7Tm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The succubus gives a willing humanoid a profane gift. That creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. As long as the gift persists, the succubus can communicate telepathically with the target at any distance, see through the creature's senses, and target the creature with suggestion through the telepathic link. In addition, the creature uses an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolls on saving throws against the succubus's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} spells.

A humanoid can't have more than one profane gift at a time, and a succubus can't grant more than one profane gift at a time. Removing the gift requires an atone ritual. The succubus can remove the gift as a free action to give the recipient a curse, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} with an unlimited duration.

A summoned succubus can't grant a profane gift.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.g5Yen1FhEMCzCJkv]{Effect: Profane Gift}
vgbSuZiK389nv7Tm.name: Profane Gift

vkMvsL1nrlHkiJQQ.description: The succubus attempts to [[/act grapple skill=diplomacy]]{Grapple} a creature using their Diplomacy bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, the succubus automatically succeeds.
vkMvsL1nrlHkiJQQ.name: Embrace

Enava.name: Enava
Enava.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.description: The brain guzzler has integrated nanites that swarm over damage, healing it.
1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.name: Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7)

VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.name: Cybernetics

Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories, and its Intelligence increases by +1. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.
Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.name: Guzzle

1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.description: The brain guzzler has integrated nanites that swarm over damage, healing it.
1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.name: Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7)
