Puddles Phantom (5-6).name: Puddles Phantom (5-6)
Puddles Phantom (5-6).npcAllSaves: -1 status to all saves vs. death effects

17N9SiA9mG2WfitQ.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Pure Legionnaire Strides twice. If they end their movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.
17N9SiA9mG2WfitQ.name: Sudden Charge

TLaTqD2bEjWTGD7s.name: +2 Status to All Saves Against Divine Magic

YyOkIdP52leMxTUP.description: The scimitars of the Pure Legion have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.
YyOkIdP52leMxTUP.name: Smite Divine

nknQxhl4L8wHTo3B.description: When the Pure Legionnaire rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.
nknQxhl4L8wHTo3B.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden

Pure Legionnaire.name: Pure Legionnaire
Pure Legionnaire.npcAllSaves: +2 on all saves against divine magic

Pusk (PFS 6-00).description:
Among the lowest and least powerful of all demons, the wretched pusks are just as vicious and cruel as their more powerful brethren. They happily vent their frustrations on anything weaker than themselves.

Born from the souls of the slothful, these demons appear vaguely humanoid in appearance with awkward limbs and slack lumps of skin hanging from their frames. Supposedly, a single slothful soul of sufficient depravity and strength can spawn an entire horde of these creatures. However, as weaker demons, their lot in life is to suffer at the hands of more powerful Abyssal predators, and only a tiny number of pusks ever manage to become something more. For this reason, pusks are quite accommodating when summoned by mortals. They're usually content to work under conditions few other fiends would accept, although they'll still gladly turn on even the kindest of masters who show even the slightest hint of weakness.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

Lb8baU3vfeAtn1Nw.description: The pusk makes itself as small as possible, protecting its vital organs with its limbs. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC but takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls. This lasts until the pusk moves from its current space, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or ends the effect as a free action.
Lb8baU3vfeAtn1Nw.name: Cower

h8caQJMnKj4F22zZ.description: The pusk makes three claw Strikes, each at a –2 penalty, all targeting the same creature. The pusk's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks. The pusk gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} condition until the beginning of its next turn.
h8caQJMnKj4F22zZ.name: Frenzied Slashes

p6uToNU7wgFDgDDH.description:
When a pusk regains their actions, roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Actions Regained]]{1d4}. The pusk regains that many actions for the turn (to a maximum of 3, or 2 if the pusk is a minion).

Effects like the slowed condition can further reduce their number of actions.
p6uToNU7wgFDgDDH.name: Sloth

xdQJFj57QglkQXeG.description: A pusk makes the most of any weakness it finds. Whenever a pusk scores a critical hit with its claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d6[bleed]]{1d6 persistent bleed} damage.
xdQJFj57QglkQXeG.name: Vicious Criticals

Pusk (PFS 6-00).name: Pusk (PFS 6-00)

Rain-Soaked Crowd.description: A crowd of carnival goers are spurred to panic by supernatural rain.
Rain-Soaked Crowd.hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:17] (trained) to calm them down, @Check[intimidation|dc:18] (trained) to cow them, @Check[athletics|dc:20] (trained) to force them back
Rain-Soaked Crowd.name: Rain-Soaked Crowd

Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6).description: A crowd of carnival goers are spurred to panic by supernatural rain.
Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:21] (trained) to calm them down, @Check[intimidation|dc:22] (trained) to cow them, @Check[athletics|dc:24] (trained) to force them back
Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6).name: Rain-Soaked Crowd (5-6)

Rasping Cicada.description:
These small insects are a nuisance and danger to small villages within Brevoy, taking over entire forests and blending in with the foliage. Also known as calling beetles, due to their ability to mimic and repeat the voices of their previous victims, crying cicadas wait for passersby to lure into the trees, fascinating their victims with their cries before fluttering their wings to release toxic dust. Once a target is near death, crying cicadas will take flight from the trees and land on the body to feed.

The scale dust of crying cicadas can be turned into an effective ingested poison, but obtaining a cicada and harvesting these scales is so dangerous that most would-be poisoners simply die in the process. Even finding the insects is dangerous enough; crying cicadas' natural stealth and dark coloration make them difficult to locate among the trees of a forest, and following their cries often leads one to fall victim to the very creatures they're hunting.

The longer a colony of crying cicadas stays in a forest, the wider their collection of cries grows. Often, a young colony will be able to replicate only the sounds of small, dying creatures, but larger, more established colonies will have the ability to mimic the sounds of children and dragons.

YKTvAlrNoc9ohi3v.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage plus slowed 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)
YKTvAlrNoc9ohi3v.name: Rasping Cicada Poison

p6CCIwIhLTWNlbfR.description:
Requirements An enemy creature has spoken since the rasping cicada's last turn

Effect The rasping cicada learns and mimics the sound of its opponent's voice. It can't make new sentences, but it can choose to repeat select parts of the phrases it has heard. All non-cicada creatures within 30 feet, other than the owner of the stolen voice, must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:15] save to disbelieve the mimicry.
p6CCIwIhLTWNlbfR.name: Steal Voice

Rasping Cicada.name: Rasping Cicada

LQwIeFmRujywT6zT.description:
Trigger An enemy enters into melee range of Minister Jo

Frequency once per hour

Effect Minister Jo is not a fighter and would prefer to be safely behind his bodyguards. He flees, Striding up to his Speed, and he must end his movement closer to the Appraiser than when he started. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, he can Reload his sukgung and then fire it backward over his shoulder in a panic, attempting a sukgung Strike against the triggering creature.
LQwIeFmRujywT6zT.name: Cowardly Flight

b9FQMGhETCHSDlXK.description:
Requirements Minister Jo has expensive bolts

Effect Minister Jo supplements his mediocre fighting ability with a variety of cheaply sourced magical items. He Reloads his sukgung with an expensive bolt and activates its magic, imbuing his next sukgung Strike with one of the following effects.

  • Shuffling Bolt (teleportation) If the bolt hits a target, the target and Minister Jo swap places. If the triggering hit was a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round after the teleportation.
  • Snare Bolt If the bolt hits a target, silk webbing wraps around them, imposing a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, or until they [[/act escape dc=25]] against a DC of 25. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes.
  • Spark Bolt (electricity) The bolt deals an additional @Damage[(2d12[splash])[electricity]] damage.
b9FQMGhETCHSDlXK.name: Expensive Reload

Reinforced Hot Spring Statue.description:
Giant animated statues' increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Tasks beyond their capabilities typically require a more advanced construct, not an animated object.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.
FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)

M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.description: The statue hinges open, revealing boiling water within it, and then plunges a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in. The target takes @Damage[3d10[fire],1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.
M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.name: Boil Alive

v0n7ntTptPAp7TPz.description: The statue is magically powered by the same geothermal power that heats the waters in Maecho's hot springs. Dealing 18 cold damage to the statue cools it off, preventing it from using Boil Alive, removing the fire damage from its ranged attacks, and making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for one round, after which the cold water cycles out of the statue and it returns to its usual temperature.
v0n7ntTptPAp7TPz.name: Geothermally Heated

Reinforced Hot Spring Statue.name: Reinforced Hot Spring Statue

2byeGaISmswuUpxU.description: When Captain Nanaeil rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.
2byeGaISmswuUpxU.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden

4LPO8MfLTdkoM9NV.description: Nanaeil lashes out at his foe with both weapons. He makes two Strikes, one with each melee weapon, each using his current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If both attacks hit, combine their damage, then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. Precision damage is added only once. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty.
4LPO8MfLTdkoM9NV.name: Double Slice

NQMFcbNx3quS2mgG.description: The Pure Legion's scimitars have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.
NQMFcbNx3quS2mgG.name: Smite Divine

QOT0UbjPYnIIySH9.name: +2 on All Saves Against Divine Magic

jr5CFCk4BfGaQErO.description: Pitros Nanaeil is highly trained in the art of wielding two weapons at once, preferring to wield the +1 striking scimitar in his main hand and the bloodletting kukri in his off-hand.
jr5CFCk4BfGaQErO.name: Dual-Weapon Warrior

liIsPsXqsjby7neR.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically fails to Strike you.

A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against the triggering opponent.
liIsPsXqsjby7neR.name: Twin Riposte

r0C8GUjKqvNfnURR.description: 30 feet. As captain of the Pure Legion, Nanaeil bolsters the lower-level legionnaires under his command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and +2 status bonus to their will saves.
r0C8GUjKqvNfnURR.name: Aura of Command

Resolved Captain Pitros Nanaeil.name: Resolved Captain Pitros Nanaeil
Resolved Captain Pitros Nanaeil.npcAllSaves: +2 on all saves against divine magic

KBXx2BWUqjJrkwhL.description:
The retriever makes a ranged eye ray Strike against an enemy within 60 feet. On a hit, the retriever chooses one of the four options listed below. The retriever cannot use the same effect in consecutive rounds. Once the retriever has used all four options, the eye ray Strike can't be used for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Cold The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[cold]] damage
  • Electricity The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[electricity]] damage
  • Fire The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[fire]] damage
  • Petrification The enemy is targeted by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} using the retriever's innate spell DC (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:earth]).
KBXx2BWUqjJrkwhL.name: Eye Ray

Riftcarver.description: Riftcarver is the chthonic artifact weapon of Deskari, the slain demon lord of the locust host and plague of the Worldwound (now known as the Sarkoris Scar). Unfettered from its creator, it now wreaks havoc on the enemies of its current master, Hesla Embersplitter.
Riftcarver.hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:24] (expert), @Check[Demon Lore|dc:24] (trained), or @Check[religion|dc:24] (expert) to remind Riftcarver that it should not serve an interloper; @Check[intimidation|dc:28] (trained), @Check[nature|dc:28] (trained), or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (trained) to temporarily make Riftcarver's spirit cower; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th rank, counteract DC 25); three total successes are required to disable the hazard. The first time Riftcarver is taken away from Hesla Embersplitter against her will (via disarm, a spell, or some other method), it also counts as one success. If Hesla Embersplitter is rendered @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or killed, the hazard immediately ends.
Riftcarver.hazardRoutine: (three actions) Riftcarver lives up to its name, using all three of its actions to carve a new rift in a random direction (rolling [[/gmr 1d8]] to determine that direction). Hesla Embersplitter is immune to the effects of these rifts while wielding Riftcarver.
Riftcarver.name: Riftcarver

Riftcarver (11-12).description: Riftcarver is the chthonic artifact weapon of Deskari, the slain demon lord of the locust host and plague of the Worldwound (now known as the Sarkoris Scar). Unfettered from its creator, it now wreaks havoc on the enemies of its current master, Hesla Embersplitter.
Riftcarver (11-12).hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:27] (expert), @Check[Demon Lore|dc:27] (trained), or @Check[religion|dc:27] (expert) to remind Riftcarver that it should not serve an interloper; @Check[intimidation|dc:32] (trained), @Check[nature|dc:32] (trained), or @Check[occultism|dc:32] (trained) to temporarily make Riftcarver's spirit cower; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th rank, counteract DC 28); three total successes are required to disable the hazard. The first time Riftcarver is taken away from Hesla Embersplitter against her will (via disarm, a spell, or some other method), it also counts as one success. If Hesla Embersplitter is rendered @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or killed, the hazard immediately ends.
Riftcarver (11-12).hazardRoutine: (three actions) Riftcarver lives up to its name, using all three of its actions to carve a new rift in a random direction (rolling [[/gmr 1d8]] to determine that direction). Hesla Embersplitter is immune to the effects of these rifts while wielding Riftcarver.
Riftcarver (11-12).name: Riftcarver (11-12)

Rimesnap.description:
"True" twigjacks, as they consider themselves, are found in wild forests alongside the fey they idolize.

Maladjusted forest denizens, twigjacks form from the cruel and prankish combination of fey and the very woods in which they reside. A twigjack's body is made up of prickly brambles woven with vines. Shaggy, mossy growth, not unlike hair, tops a twigjack's head. Its mouth is just a canyon of splintered and broken sticks bisecting its face. Leaves and sprigs of new growth randomly sprout from the creature's body. Many dense forests on Golarion have at least a handful of twigjacks living in the undergrowth.

While truculent and violent, twigjacks care deeply for what they consider to be their forests. These creatures harass outsiders who delve deep into their wooded domains, forcing back even the most determined explorers, foresters, and travelers, especially when those intruders cut roads through the forest. However, they are not terribly territorial when it comes to other forest creatures. When sylvan creatures, especially fey, rally against an outside threat, twigjacks in the area eagerly arrive to fight, even if they were not invited.

1abnSJGdHEvG6Lyl.description:
Requirements Rimesnap is in undergrowth

Effect Rimesnap scrambles into the undergrowth and instantly teleports to a square of undergrowth within 60 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
1abnSJGdHEvG6Lyl.name: Bramble Jump

dOcDYCNGkTD6GGcZ.description: Rimesnap sprays a volley of frozen pine needles from their body in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], dealing @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[cold]|options:area-damage]{1d6 piercing and 1d6 cold} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save). Rimesnap can't use Pine spray again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pine spray]]{1d4 rounds}.
dOcDYCNGkTD6GGcZ.name: Pine Spray

Rimesnap.name: Rimesnap

Ritual Effects.description: The effects of Hesla's profane ritual ripple outward through Deskari's Gullet. Physical tremors shake the cavern complex, while magical waves of energy affect those opposed to her actions.
Ritual Effects.hazardDisable: This hazard persists until Hesla's ritual is complete and her demonic forces defeated.
Ritual Effects.hazardRoutine: (two actions) The ground shakes, and waves of demonic energy surge through the cavern. Each PC must make a save against tremors and a save against demonic energy. Enemy combatants must only make the Reflex save against tremors; they are immune to the Demonic Energy effects.
Ritual Effects.name: Ritual Effects

11SMR9i2SDGSrgtn.description:
Trigger Rowan has thrown her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ZvIEJCY60fHqzl6r]{Serpent Dagger} at a target

Frequency once per turn

Effect After the attack's result is resolved, Rowan yanks on the cord attached to the weapon's hilt, returning it to her hand. If she throws the weapon to a distance of 20 feet or beyond, this ability becomes 1-action and gains the manipulate trait.
11SMR9i2SDGSrgtn.name: Tether Pull

QC1C7qTJXeZS9gNQ.description:
Requirements Rowan is within 30 feet of one of the circular mirrors in the southern two rooms of the laboratory

Effect Rowan uses her connection to the aiudara fragments to translocate. She Strides once into one of the circular mirrors, teleporting to any other such mirror of her choice. When she does this, she leaves behind a mirrored image of herself until the start of her next turn. This image acts as an ally for all purposes, but has an AC of 0, 1 HP, and cannot take actions.
QC1C7qTJXeZS9gNQ.name: Mirror Step

cmGhYmv28lFbpAeV.description: Rowan's strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her, or who are within reach of at least one of her allies.
cmGhYmv28lFbpAeV.name: Flash Attack

KBXx2BWUqjJrkwhL.description:
The retriever makes a ranged eye ray Strike against an enemy within 60 feet. On a hit, the retriever chooses one of the four options listed below. The retriever cannot use the same effect in consecutive rounds. Once the retriever has used all four options, the eye ray Strike can't be used for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Cold The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[cold]] damage
  • Electricity The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[electricity]] damage
  • Fire The enemy takes @Damage[(2d12+13)[fire]] damage
  • Petrification The enemy is targeted by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} using the retriever's innate spell DC (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:earth]).
KBXx2BWUqjJrkwhL.name: Eye Ray

G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.description: The automatic greeter has Hardness. Once the automatic greeter is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 15.
G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)

Sailor's Warning (1-2).description: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:14] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:17] or @Check[occultism|dc:17] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st rank; counteract DC 14) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (1-2).hazardRoutine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save).
Sailor's Warning (1-2).name: Sailor's Warning (1-2)

Sailor's Warning (3-4).description: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:18] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:20] or @Check[occultism|dc:20] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (3-4).hazardRoutine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[(1d8)[bludgeoning],(1d8)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save).
Sailor's Warning (3-4).name: Sailor's Warning (3-4)

Sailor's Warning (5-6).description: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:21] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:23] or @Check[occultism|dc:23] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 21) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (5-6).hazardRoutine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning],(1d6+3)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save).
Sailor's Warning (5-6).name: Sailor's Warning (5-6)

Sailor's Warning (7-8).description: An illusory cyclops in oracular robes cries out a warning, but then dissolves into a violent phantasmal cyclops, which calls out for the Blind Formless Chaos That Lies Behind the Stars to accept his sacrifice. It then plunges an obsidian athame into a creature's chest, summoning a foul entity.
Sailor's Warning (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:25] (trained) to repair Chamenaiti's magic, @Check[religion|dc:27] or @Check[occultism|dc:27] (trained) to offset the prayer, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 25) to counteract the warning
Sailor's Warning (7-8).hazardRoutine: a Rubbery crimson tentacles appear from a rip in the air and grasp at all creatures in the area, dealing @Damage[(2d8)[bludgeoning],(2d8)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save).
Sailor's Warning (7-8).name: Sailor's Warning (7-8)

Sargassum Bud Pile.description: Sargassum heaps that have only started to grow have no intelligence, but are incredibly tenacious and can reflexively grab onto nearby prey. They obtain nutrients by drowning prey in the water they grow in.
Sargassum Bud Pile.hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:32] (expert) to rip the reflexive tendrils off the bud or @Check[thievery|dc:32] (expert) to trigger the tendrils beforehand and keep them occupied.
Sargassum Bud Pile.hazardReset: 1 hour if the bud pile has something in its grasps. 1 round if the bud pile has nothing in its grasps.
Sargassum Bud Pile.name: Sargassum Bud Pile

AilGhPmdBdlWMTKC.description: A Sarkorian red bison's charge shakes the earth. The bison Strides twice and can move through the spaces of creatures at least one size smaller. Each creature whose square the bison enters must takes @Damage[(2d6+9)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). A creature that critically fails this save takes double damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
AilGhPmdBdlWMTKC.name: Thundering Hooves

Scouring Pool.description: The swirling water in this pool entices anyone who can see or hear it to wander into its depths, drowning its victims.
Scouring Pool.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:27] to scratch out the runes creating the effect, @Check[occultism|dc:23] (expert) or @Check[Demon Lore|dc:23] (expert) to determine the password that identifies the party as believers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd-rank; counteract DC 25); two total successes are required to deactivate the pool.
Scouring Pool.hazardRoutine:
(1 action; mental) The cleansing pool uses its first action to try and compel all creatures within 5 feet to enter into the pool. Creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23|traits:mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is immune to the pool's routine for 1 minute.

Success No effect.

Failure The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} condition and attempts to enter the pool.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must also use all of their actions on their next turn to try and pull one of their allies into the pool with them.
Scouring Pool.name: Scouring Pool

sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.
sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.name: Fanatical Frenzy

D1jLgPLWINszKQOB.description:
Requirements The necromancer isn't drained and has at least one undead entity active

Effect The necromancer overloads their undead entities with void energy, causing all of them to explode. Each entity is destroyed, dealing @Damage[4d10[void]] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] with a @Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save. A creature in more than one explosion is damaged only once. The necromancer becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.
D1jLgPLWINszKQOB.name: Wave of Death

EaUnUSWnKFqCTrTs.description:
Requirements The necromancer has at least one undead entity active

Effect The necromancer commands all their undead entities to attack. Each entity can Stride up to 20 feet into an empty square and make a Strike. The Strike has a +15 attack modifier and deals 2d12 bludgeoning damage (or spirit damage if the entity is a spirit). The Strike has the magical trait, and no multiple attack penalty applies to it.
EaUnUSWnKFqCTrTs.name: Undead, Attack!

ZxXTiW5MEaSFTJL9.description: The necromancer emits a scent of putrid rot in a 5-foot emanation. Anyone that enters or begins its turn in the aura that is not a member of the Cult of the Screaming Grub is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.
ZxXTiW5MEaSFTJL9.name: Stench of Decay

pYJlWGSXDHVVLKb7.description:
The necromancer summons two Medium undead entities in different empty squares up to 30 feet away. These undead entities can take the form of zombies, skeletons, or ghosts, chosen by the necromancer. The entities block movement as though they were creatures and can be attacked. Each entity has 1 Hit Point and the same AC and saves as the necromancer. They can't take actions of their own and deteriorate if the necromancer is reduced to 0 Hit Points. The necromancer can have up to four undead entities at any given time. If they call another, the oldest undead entity deteriorates.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-6-bestiary.Actor.DclMSxfKDPrsc48z]{Screaming Grub Undead}
pYJlWGSXDHVVLKb7.name: Undead, Arise!

sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.
sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.name: Fanatical Frenzy

PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.description: Shadow Lesolethe causes the shadows cast by those around her to transform into a mesh of blades which erupt upwards at her foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Enemy creatures in the area take @Damage[4d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).
PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.name: Blades of Shade

vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.description: Shadow Lesolethe utters a scream which causes shadows to churn and boil. Each living enemy within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Boiling Darkness for 1 minute.
vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.name: Boiling Darkness

Shadowpact Goliath Spider.description:
Goliath spiders dwell in the deepest jungles, where they build webs as big as temples and feast on prey as large as hippopotami.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

Be8ZCKKmNDNPgCM0.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}
Be8ZCKKmNDNPgCM0.name: Goliath Spider Venom

Eu72dpTXiYJQD7Hm.description:
A creature hit by the spider's web Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and tethered to the spider, preventing it from moving farther away from the spider.

The spider can have one creature tethered at a time. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} the web is 30. The tether can be severed with a Strike (AC 20, Hardness 5, HP 20), but this doesn't free the restrained creature.
Eu72dpTXiYJQD7Hm.name: Web Tether

ZGT5tuxpKDfepkTr.description: The shadowpact goliath spider never triggers the reactions of hazards in its own lair and is immune to the negative consequences of damaging area effects created by hazards in its lair (so if a PC set off a hazard that released a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} inside its lair, it would not take damage from the fireball even if it was within the fireball's area).
ZGT5tuxpKDfepkTr.name: Hazard Immunity

aAGnyUk4Vj6iSM7n.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the goliath spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The goliath spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.
aAGnyUk4Vj6iSM7n.name: Spring Upon Prey

oXZ3YdyxyoVGRGJs.description:
The goliath spider has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]
oXZ3YdyxyoVGRGJs.name: Web Sense

x1hzvAiCUjfrEaZO.description:
The goliath spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 5, 20 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.
x1hzvAiCUjfrEaZO.name: Descend on a Web

Shadowpact Goliath Spider.name: Shadowpact Goliath Spider

Shadowpact Shadow.description:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Netherworld and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

6PZpeNlYGVEoZJmo.description: The shadowpact shadow deals an additional 1d6 precision damage on their next Strike whenever they use an action to Stride 10 or more feet.
6PZpeNlYGVEoZJmo.name: Deadly Striker

VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.
VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.name: Slink in Shadows

c9FbrbyXGCZAqGN8.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shadowpact shadow automatically ends one effect that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed.
c9FbrbyXGCZAqGN8.name: Unimpeded

kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).
kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.name: Light Vulnerability

sslSR9PEr8cWdVop.description:
Requirements The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.
sslSR9PEr8cWdVop.name: Steal Shadow

zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow, it becomes a greater shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it, using these statistics without Deadly Striker, Steal Shadow, or Unimpeded. This shadow spawn is incurably @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous greater shadow, gaining Steal Shadow and losing the clumsy condition. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.
zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.name: Greater Shadow Spawn

Shadowpact Shadow.name: Shadowpact Shadow

Shadowpact Statue.description:
Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Many less scrupulous adventurers, fueled by paranoia that statues will animate and attack, smash any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

T0JcrrU5zyi61Zeh.description: The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise within reach. Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue. Dealing @Damage[15[cold]] damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal fire damage.
T0JcrrU5zyi61Zeh.name: Brazier

YLEBJdSlLikGbKMn.description: The statue grinds a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d8[fire]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.
YLEBJdSlLikGbKMn.name: Burn Alive

dOlE012wah1QqChP.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The shadowpact statue is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 3}

Trigger The shadowpact statue is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The shadowpact statue avoids being knocked out and remains at half its maximum HP, but its wounded value increases by 1.
dOlE012wah1QqChP.name: Mythic Ferocity

dkfqFFDoPeLbQKNp.description: Like normal objects, a shadowpact statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a shadowpact statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 22.
dkfqFFDoPeLbQKNp.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)

Shadowpact Statue.name: Shadowpact Statue

Shadowpact Stone Bulwark.description: Stone bulwarks are slow and steady constructs typically carved from marble or granite. They're often made to serve as works of art when at rest, so some magical crafters employ master sculptors to ensure their constructs make beautiful statues. Older stone bulwarks might be weathered, with scuffed or cracked surfaces or missing noses and digits, but this weathering is largely cosmetic and doesn't adversely impact the bulwark's functionality.

AQkAJLS7IVqr7GLQ.description: Any creature hit by the stone bulwark's fist or rock Strike is affected by a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind} spell.
AQkAJLS7IVqr7GLQ.name: Binding Stone

bKmTRJI4PjS70sWZ.description: The stone bulwark Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise it is damaged as if hit by the construct's fist.
bKmTRJI4PjS70sWZ.name: Inexorable March

bhmnG9zTS4ncYGoL.description:
20 feet.

Rocks of marble magically arise from the ground in the aura. They protect the bulwark's allies, giving each of them standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Cover}. These stones can be used for Throw Rock.

This aura automatically activates at the start of the stone bulwark's first turn in combat and deactivates at the end of combat.
bhmnG9zTS4ncYGoL.name: Statuary Aura

j0KjQKuc5uvWrFxj.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The stone bulwark is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 3}

Trigger The stone bulwark is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The stone bulwark avoids being knocked out and remains at half its maximum HP, but its wounded value increases by 1.
j0KjQKuc5uvWrFxj.name: Mythic Ferocity

Shadowpact Stone Bulwark.name: Shadowpact Stone Bulwark

Shadowpact Tarantula.description:
Tarantulas are ambush predators, but will attack prey in the open.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

hoyH5NP3Cx5Ug5Zm.description: The shadowpact tarantula never triggers the reactions of hazards in its own lair and is immune to the negative consequences of damaging area effects created by hazards in its lair (so if a PC set off a hazard that released a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} inside its lair, it would not take damage from the fireball even if it was within the fireball's area).
hoyH5NP3Cx5Ug5Zm.name: Hazard Immunity

pzO0JwhFqVcRKzAN.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 8 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 4 2d6 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)
pzO0JwhFqVcRKzAN.name: Giant Tarantula Venom

xGPdcgIZR0tAI9IY.description: The tarantula flicks its legs, flinging spiky hairs in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. This deals @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save.
xGPdcgIZR0tAI9IY.name: Hair Barrage

Shadowpact Tarantula.name: Shadowpact Tarantula

Shadowpact Vampire.description:
Vampire masterminds are evil wizards who control entire cabals of the undead and instill fear in the hearts of mortals far and wide.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.

9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The vampire mastermind hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The vampire expends the power stored in their signet ring. This gives the vampire the ability to cast one prepared spell they had already previously cast today without spending a spell slot. The vampire must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.
9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.name: Drain Bonded Item

DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the vampire mastermind's spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. If the vampire succeeds, their action isn't disrupted.
DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.name: Steady Spellcasting

GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities. Shadowpact vampires lack a typical vampire's vulnerability to sunlight.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities

GuozOBpJ0vRt64hK.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shadowpact vampire automatically ends one effect that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed.
GuozOBpJ0vRt64hK.name: Unimpeded

HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]]{10 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.
HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.name: Drink Blood

NrOC0MiULczUiNCV.description: The shadowpact vampire deals an additional 1d6 precision damage on their next Strike whenever they use an action to Stride 10 or more feet.
NrOC0MiULczUiNCV.name: Deadly Striker

zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

  • Giant Bat
    • Senses echolocation 40 feet,
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet,
    • Melee fangs +19 Damage 2d8+9 piercing

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.name: Change Shape

Shadowpact Vampire.name: Shadowpact Vampire
Shadowpact Vampire.npcHp: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, void healing

Shambling Plague Zombie.description:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

MuiyXm8KyQF57NaW.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.
MuiyXm8KyQF57NaW.name: Jaws

RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately
RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.name: Zombie Rot

a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.name: Slow

Shambling Plague Zombie.name: Shambling Plague Zombie

Shard-Empowered Levaloch.description:
Fearsome giants of jagged iron, levalochs serve in the armies of Hell as potent warriors and tenacious hunters-creatures of absolute discipline endlessly obedient to diabolical tyrants.

There are countless legions of lawful fiends in the nine layers of Hell, warring against the celestial planes and scouring the Material Plane for souls to corrupt.

T6ZAqc1mMzmpUCtm.description:
When a levaloch hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

When a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 23), or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into rust.

Each time a creature attempts to Escape, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}
T6ZAqc1mMzmpUCtm.name: Barbed Net

X5bjxwBhWpEDkFUA.description: A levaloch recalls their warshard-infused iron back to create a new +1 striking trident or barbed net. A creatures on the line between the weapon and the levaloch must make a basic @Check[reflex|dc:23] save against @Damage[7d8[piercing]] damage. The levaloch's previous trident crumbles to rust. When the levaloch is destroyed, any tridents or barbed nets they created crumble to rust.
X5bjxwBhWpEDkFUA.name: Forge Warshard Weapon

cQMEu0nbq6cPn2sD.description:
A levaloch ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. They take no damage from caltrops or from damaging terrain that deals physical, acid, or cold damage.

A levaloch can move through liquids up to 5 feet deep at their full Speed.
cQMEu0nbq6cPn2sD.name: Hellstrider

rXrJgVzgOwMP7Cbr.description: A levaloch gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude DC against being Shoved and to other saving throws to resist being moved against their will.
rXrJgVzgOwMP7Cbr.name: Stable Stance

sX0MwC23Mvp1YeD2.description: When a levaloch hits a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} conditions with a melee trident Strike, the Strike deals an additional [[/r 2d6]] damage.
sX0MwC23Mvp1YeD2.name: Merciless Thrust

u3ndMdQRfiAH7Z7J.description:
All devils of equal or lower level adjacent to a levaloch gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC as the levaloch shields them from harm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.KjWPSJonzrZ8jv7X]{Effect: Phalanx Fighter}
u3ndMdQRfiAH7Z7J.name: Phalanx Fighter

Shard-Empowered Levaloch.name: Shard-Empowered Levaloch
Shard-Empowered Levaloch.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Shard-Empowered Vordine.description:
The vast city of Dis trains endless legions of vordines to guard the upper layers of Hell and march across the planes at the archdevils' orders. Although quick to bend their knees to higher-ranking devils and even mortals favored by Asmodeus, vordines are relentlessly cruel to orts and other devils they can call their subordinates.

Although higher ranks in the infernal military are held by more powerful devils, like the nessari who serve as generals, a labyrinthine structure gives each vordine a rank and certain responsibilities. Some vordines are responsible for the battlefield command of squads, while others relay orders from above or are set to handling specific administrative tasks for their unit. The greatest gift one can offer a vordine is an increased rank to lord over other vordines.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.

1FRWXS0j3BI8ETs7.description:
Trigger A creature successfully Strikes the vordine

Effect The vordine immediately grows a warshard shield out of its arm, gaining +2 AC against the triggering Strike. This shield then functions as a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4k99nOJudmeNnBTF]{Shielded Arm} spell would.
1FRWXS0j3BI8ETs7.name: Reactive Shield Arm

6Qu68Hmw1P67f6XV.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The vordine draws upon the power of the warshard to bolster its health. It gains fast healing 5 for 1 minute.
6Qu68Hmw1P67f6XV.name: Warshard Healing

htudWd2S9lUKBAuJ.description: The vordine Strides, trailing hoofprints in each square they exit. The hoofprints burn for 1 minute. A creature on the ground that enters a square with burning hoofprints or begins its turn in one takes @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage.
htudWd2S9lUKBAuJ.name: Burning Hoofprints

x38RhSkJxk1CkeQZ.description: The vordine makes a trident Strike, increasing their reach to 10 feet for that Strike. If there is an unholy ally between the vordine and their target, that creature's energy causes the Strike to deal an additional 1d6 spirit damage.
x38RhSkJxk1CkeQZ.name: Trident of Dis

Shard-Empowered Vordine.name: Shard-Empowered Vordine
Shard-Empowered Vordine.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

3ayqAtUeKoqZ9epD.description: Sharkskin isn't off-guard to creatures of 7th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.
3ayqAtUeKoqZ9epD.name: Deny Advantage

4FoiuzgBijmkqFyd.description:
Activate A (manipulate)

The stopper for a potion of emergency escape is crafted to easily snap open in dire circumstances. When you drink this potion, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 minute, and you gain a +40-foot status bonus to all your Speeds for the duration as long as you are fleeing. You immediately Stride.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.EZsHuGGSLER67CiM]{Effect: Potion of Emergency Escape}

5kuNDj7RIaE2aITA.description: Sharkskin makes one Strike with xir +1 striking fearsome scimitar and then one with xir +1 striking underwater scimitar. If xe hits with the first attack, xir target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second attack.
5kuNDj7RIaE2aITA.name: Twin Feint

H3idZRPOZSXBOGiL.description:
Trigger Sharkskin reduces an enemy to 0 hit points

Effect Sharkskin attempts an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature xe can see with a +2 circumstance bonus.
H3idZRPOZSXBOGiL.name: You're Next

PnmSVgJt14wOTuzJ.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Sharkskin would be hit by an attack against xir AC

Effect Xe gains a +1 circumstance bonus to xir AC against the attack, or a +2 circumstance bonus if the attack is in water or has the amphibious, aquatic, or water trait. Whether the attack hits or misses, xe gains a +2 status bonus to damage with the next Strike xe makes against the attacker before the end of xir next turn.
PnmSVgJt14wOTuzJ.name: Triangular Teeth

aVWVuvj8FJ9uCrI1.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are off-guard to Sharkskin.
aVWVuvj8FJ9uCrI1.name: Surprise Attack

q9t0GJ2pl5AxTsm6.description:
Rows of triangles symbolizing shark teeth protect you from danger and enable you to take fierce retaliation against those who try to harm you. Seafarers, especially those on the seas of Minata, wear these tattoos in patterns, with multiple rows of regular triangles. You gain a +1 item bonus to Survival checks to navigate bodies of water.

Activate R command

Frequency once per day

Trigger You would be hit by an attack against your AC

Effect You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the attack, or a +2 circumstance bonus if the attacker is in water or has the amphibious, aquatic, or water trait. Whether the attack hits or misses, you gain a +2 status bonus to damage with the next Strike you make against the attacker before the end of your next turn.

wbv36i5KSpXeVboX.description: Sharkskin ignores the usual penalties for using a bludgeoning or slashing melee weapon in water. In addition, xe can hold xir breath for 175 rounds before suffocating.
wbv36i5KSpXeVboX.name: Pirate Training

y9f2cZCGDlilXxpX.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Shredder Tyrannosaurus.description:
Widely regarded as the king of the dinosaurs, the tyrannosaurus is a massive predator with a wide mouth filled with viciously sharp teeth. Some tribes of giants have even trained tyrannosauruses as mounts or beasts of war.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

24g2FSPaGiTvJB6C.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the tyrannosaurus's jaws

Effect The tyrannosaurus flings the creature into the air up to 10 feet up from its mouth and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the tyrannosaurus flings it as high as it can) and takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save.
24g2FSPaGiTvJB6C.name: Fling

9gYASQQf328TmVpW.description:
Trigger The tyrannosaurus critically hits a Large or smaller foe with its foot

Effect The creature struck by the foot is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and held in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn't move from its position, the pinned creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner but can only Swallow Whole if that creature is grabbed with its jaws.
9gYASQQf328TmVpW.name: Pin Prey

Shredder Tyrannosaurus.name: Shredder Tyrannosaurus

tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.description: Silver Devil delinquents benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil delinquents are adjacent to that creature.
tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.name: Gang Up

DyXTFnUImaBRP7NF.description: A Silver Devil hooligan deals 1d6 additional damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} opponent.

tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.description: Silver Devil hooligans benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil hooligans are adjacent to that creature.
tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.name: Gang Up
